commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I0b91ce60a0c315d0d2f5594f7feb2a56755d8625
(cherry picked from commit f1e84b403215b0efa3f2c5d04943a96c237fc609)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 04:48:46.000000000', 'message': "[placement] set accept to application/json if accept not set

If an incoming request to placement does not set the accept header
force it to 'application/json'. This not only ensures that error
responses are in JSON but also that errors early in the middleware
stack do not cause a key error (see the #1724065 bug).

This fix is done by checking headers early in the middleware stack
using the requestlog middleware as a convenient place to do the
check. This overloads requestlog's purpose, but avoids adding yet
more middleware (doing so has some small impact per request).

Fixing bug 1724065 fixes a 500. Fixing bug 1674694 changes (for some
requests) the content type of the bodies of 400-499 responses. This
creates a bit of quandry for microversion handling. If a microversion
is considered required here then it's not clear the global fix is
worth doing and the 500 fix should be limited the microversion
middleware. The intent all along has been that responses should
strive to align with the API-WG errors guideline [1], which assumes
application/json.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/errors.html

Change-Id: Ice27c7080fc2df097cb387f7438c0aaf32b4c63d
Closes-Bug: #1724065
Closes-Bug: #1674694
"}]
commit_message:
[placement] set accept to application/json if accept not set

If an incoming request to placement does not set the accept header
force it to 'application/json'. This not only ensures that error
responses are in JSON but also that errors early in the middleware
stack do not cause a key error (see the #1724065 bug).

This fix is done by checking headers early in the middleware stack
using the requestlog middleware as a convenient place to do the
check. This overloads requestlog's purpose, but avoids adding yet
more middleware (doing so has some small impact per request).

Fixing bug 1724065 fixes a 500. Fixing bug 1674694 changes (for some
requests) the content type of the bodies of 400-499 responses. This
creates a bit of quandry for microversion handling. If a microversion
is considered required here then it's not clear the global fix is
worth doing and the 500 fix should be limited the microversion
middleware. The intent all along has been that responses should
strive to align with the API-WG errors guideline [1], which assumes
application/json.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/api-wg/guidelines/errors.html

Change-Id: Ice27c7080fc2df097cb387f7438c0aaf32b4c63d
Closes-Bug: #1724065
Closes-Bug: #1674694

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I01c4e0393c918a6f446c6b1b4c78e2591ea45f28

commit_message:
Fix DNS connectivity issues with DVR+HA routers and DHCP-HA

Before this change, DVR_SNAT agents would get no routers when
asking for updates due to provisioning of DHCP ports on the
node they are running on. This means that there's no connectivity
between the DHCP port and the network gateway (that may be
hosted on a different node), and therefore things like DNS may
break when a VM attempts resolution when talking to the affected
DHCP port.

This change relaxed a conditional that prevents the right list of
routers to be compiled and returned from the server to the agent.
The agent on the other hand needs to make sure to allocate the
right type of router based on what is being returned from the server.

Closes-bug: #1733987

Change-Id: I6124738c3324e0cc3f7998e3a541ff7547f2a8a7

commit_message:
Correct missleading example of l2gw in readme

l2gw_plugin should be l2gw-plugin, otherwise networking-l2gw will not be
installed properly.

Change-Id: Iad84e22d4eb77f182e52af5a89837d46bb6b1a77

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 18:54:57.000000000', 'message': 'Use oslo_db Session in resource_provider.py

In a number of places in resource_provider.py, we're checking for
DBDuplicateError after running conn.execute(). And "conn" is an
SQLAlchemy Connection object. The issue is that DBDuplicateError is not
an SQLAlchemy exception. Instead, it is an oslo_db-specific exception
that is used to mask differences between DB drivers that variably return
an OperationalError or an IntegrityError when a duplicate key is found
[1].

In practice, what this means is that all calling locations that use the
straight "conn.execute()" calling sequence cannot rely on catching
DBDuplicateError (because SQLAlchemy's Connection.execute() method will
never raise it). Instead, all of those calling locations needed to be
updated to use context.session.execute() instead. This allows
DBDuplicateError to be caught properly.

In addition, all the manual construction of transactions in
resource_provider.py that did:

 with conn.begin()

needed to have those manual begin() calls removed. The reason is that
oslo_db's Session object (which is what is injected by the enginefacade
into the nova.context.RequestContext) automatically handles creation,
commit and rollback of transactions based on whether the source
entrypoint is a writer or reader context.

Closes-bug: #1731668
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/stable/pike/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py#L95-L153

Change-Id: Ic5860cbef4d47e847bb5f190526b5a8ea3c33298

commit_message:
Use oslo_db Session in resource_provider.py

In a number of places in resource_provider.py, we're checking for
DBDuplicateError after running conn.execute(). And "conn" is an
SQLAlchemy Connection object. The issue is that DBDuplicateError is not
an SQLAlchemy exception. Instead, it is an oslo_db-specific exception
that is used to mask differences between DB drivers that variably return
an OperationalError or an IntegrityError when a duplicate key is found
[1].

In practice, what this means is that all calling locations that use the
straight "conn.execute()" calling sequence cannot rely on catching
DBDuplicateError (because SQLAlchemy's Connection.execute() method will
never raise it). Instead, all of those calling locations needed to be
updated to use context.session.execute() instead. This allows
DBDuplicateError to be caught properly.

In addition, all the manual construction of transactions in
resource_provider.py that did:

 with conn.begin()

needed to have those manual begin() calls removed. The reason is that
oslo_db's Session object (which is what is injected by the enginefacade
into the nova.context.RequestContext) automatically handles creation,
commit and rollback of transactions based on whether the source
entrypoint is a writer or reader context.

Closes-bug: #1731668
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/stable/pike/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/exc_filters.py#L95-L153

Change-Id: Ic5860cbef4d47e847bb5f190526b5a8ea3c33298

[{'created': '2017-11-30 04:04:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix SSL handling for galera clusters

The SSL handler was making an assumption a user provided SSL key will
always be available. This change forces this role to look for the SSL
CA key on a galera server and set it locally IF a user provided SSL ca
certificate is not provided.

To ensure we're not introducing regressions a cross project repo test
has been added to run installations that are with and without ssl.

Change-Id: Ib89dde5cc88182f81d81336f71d9cde89733aa65
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix SSL handling for galera clusters

The SSL handler was making an assumption a user provided SSL key will
always be available. This change forces this role to look for the SSL
CA key on a galera server and set it locally IF a user provided SSL ca
certificate is not provided.

To ensure we're not introducing regressions a cross project repo test
has been added to run installations that are with and without ssl.

Depends-on: I5f6465f0d955cc1b911a4a76482505edb16c69a8
Change-Id: Ib89dde5cc88182f81d81336f71d9cde89733aa65
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Set suse mirror to a different official mirror

Recently we've been seeing slowdowns and other issues when connecting
to download.opensuse.org. This patch simply sets our default mirror
to a different option but still managed by the upstream suse team.

Change-Id: I3f14062e66b31225a4f2c12999f65b041907fc9b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
openstack subnet create fails when tags is None

In network/v2/_tag.py lines 105 and 110: obj.tags can be None, in
which case set(obj.tags) throws a NoneType exception.

Change-Id: I1e965ec947844cbf84676fab27a2261fc0c0ea49
Closes-Bug: #1735836

commit_message:
Fix quobyte test_validate_volume_no_mtab_entry

Fix test_validate_volume_no_mtab_entry. Currently depends on /etc/mtab,
this patches and mocks psutil.disk_partitions, which is the source of
the dependency.

Change-Id: Ie10b134a1840b1277c0c4059f634a6bafd256c2d
Closes-Bug: #1708196
(cherry picked from commit e1ad386f9828a6c9caf3c0cb962a3912c9a3885a)

commit_message:
Add ctlplane hiera key that contains local IP

similarly to the way that IP's are set as hiera keys in the overcloud.
This adds a key that exposes the undercloud's ctlplane IP via hiera.

The naming resembles how the overcloud's IPs are set via the net_ip_map.

Change-Id: I0c07616d660816e7ed7a3ca18d985bc8a9a892fe

commit_message:
Add Elasticsearch to OSH Infra

This moves the Elasticsearch chart to OSH infra, along with rbac
rules for running Elasticsearch. It includes a cronjob for running
ES Curator for cleaning up old indices

Change-Id: I69fcbe8b77de8b594eba5340a6e4340f389ba5bf

messages: [{'account_id': 9200, 'date': '2017-12-01 09:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27373, 'date': '2017-12-01 09:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nok'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2017-12-01 22:36:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2017-12-01 23:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 09:05:24.000000000', 'message': "ovsfw: Use multiple priorities in RULES_*_TABLE

The OpenFlow spec says packets shouldn't match against multiple flows
at the same priority or the result is undefined. In ovsfw, 8 priority
levels are needed to comply with this rule.

Note: unlike overlapping TCP port ranges cases, the current version
of OVS seems to handle this case magically.

Change-Id: I6deaee8dbe81453285b1fc685282952bc9456949
Closes-bug: #1708092
(cherry picked from commit 4ac4c22a646799aaecca61334a8bb44147ab881a)
"}]
commit_message:
ovsfw: Use multiple priorities in RULES_*_TABLE

The OpenFlow spec says packets shouldn't match against multiple flows
at the same priority or the result is undefined. In ovsfw, 8 priority
levels are needed to comply with this rule.

Note: unlike overlapping TCP port ranges cases, the current version
of OVS seems to handle this case magically.

Change-Id: I6deaee8dbe81453285b1fc685282952bc9456949
Closes-bug: #1708092
(cherry picked from commit 4ac4c22a646799aaecca61334a8bb44147ab881a)

[{'created': '2017-11-29 08:43:57.000000000', 'message': "Correct order of args passed to del_port in medata teardown_datapath

Args order of 'port' and 'bridge' passed to del_port is reversed in
teardown_datapath, ovs port left over, 'ovs-vsctl show' can see it.
This is ovsdbapp log info:
ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.transaction [-] Running txn command(idx=0):
 DelPortCommand(if_exists=True, bridge=tapf58f8949-b0, port=br-int) do_commit

Change-Id: Id9c6a702c67e4dd1288564c0424651e965ce320d
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Correct order of args passed to del_port in medata teardown_datapath

Args order of 'port' and 'bridge' passed to del_port is reversed in
teardown_datapath, ovs port left over, 'ovs-vsctl show' can see it.
This is ovsdbapp log info:
ovsdbapp.backend.ovs_idl.transaction [-] Running txn command(idx=0):
 DelPortCommand(if_exists=True, bridge=tapf58f8949-b0, port=br-int) do_commit

Change-Id: Id9c6a702c67e4dd1288564c0424651e965ce320d
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 18:31:53.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Iabdecab91b8f539500f73cf124e99ce0ee8f2bff
(cherry picked from commit 2610f577ca01617a8019673e6e2a84d1a9dc4379)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Iabdecab91b8f539500f73cf124e99ce0ee8f2bff
(cherry picked from commit 2610f577ca01617a8019673e6e2a84d1a9dc4379)

commit_message:
libvirt: refresh info_cache before creating devices metadata

In some cases, Physical functions with VLAN are not being reported via the
device's metadata, since info_cache shows as empty. Refreshing the info_cache
before metadata creation solves the problem.

Change-Id: I412302ce2ff77e91d46b55fa4c3032ff2838725a
Closes-Bug: #1694183

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I0b91ce60a0c315d0d2f5594f7feb2a56755d8625
(cherry picked from commit f1e84b403215b0efa3f2c5d04943a96c237fc609)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I0b91ce60a0c315d0d2f5594f7feb2a56755d8625

summarizing the interaction with the driver for the different events,
a)      When a port is created (handle_port). FWaaS L2 agent gets notified through L2 agent extension. This is unlike L3.  Plugin is queried to get the FWG to which this port is associated. Plugin should return the FWG for this port if one exists or should associate the DEF FWG to this port and return it.
 
First Phase: L2 Agent Extension for FWaaS will always call Update to the driver. Driver will internally do a rip off the existing rules and create this new one. At the beginning, there may not be any rules, so the driver will handle that.
Next Phase: L2 Agent will get a hint from the Plugin, if this is a create or update operation. This needs to be thought through in detail. There are cases like Agent may not be running and user does a update_firewall_group. Agent comes up. Does he get both create_port/update_firewall_group notifications?
 
b)      Delete_port.

This should take care of removing the chains associated with this port. This handler does not have access to the FWG associated with the port. Even plugin cannot be queried since the plugin would have removed the association from the DB.
So, one option is for the driver to handle the delete with just the port. Another option is for the plugin to have a status in FWG_Port association table.
 

c)      Create_fwg

Usually the user flow is to create a FWG with no ports in it. As otherwise, the validation will fail since the ports are associated with a def FWG.
Then, the user does an update FWG by adding the ports whose default behavior needs to be changed.
So, the create_fwg gets called with no ports in it. So, no call to the driver is needed. 
 
d)      Delete_fwg
 
This operation will result in the default FWG being applied to the port. The assumption is the default FWG cannot be deleted.
The agent will call the update routine of the driver, with the Def FWG.
  
 
e)      Update FWG

This should result in a update/reset for the ports removed from the FWG and update for the ports added to this FWG.'}, {'account_id': 11241, 'date': '2017-02-15 06:26:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-02-15 07:29:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Verified-1

Noticed a weird thing on the following setup: master devstack with latest 323971 and 447251 cherry-picked, firewall_l2_driver = noop.

Earlier I created 3 networks, a firewall group, booted 3 vms (one on each network) and everything went well (you can check the setup process here http://paste.openstack.org/show/623565/)
But the I created another firewall group (blunt openstack firewall group create --name aaaa) and tried adding one of the 3 vm ports as following:

openstack firewall group set aaaa --port port100502

There were no errors in the logs but the firewall group git stuck in PENDING_UPDATE state and never returned from it.

dev-user@iv-devstack-default-fwg:~/neutron_for_dummies/valley_of_lost_scripts$ openstack firewall group show aaaa
+-------------------+-------------------------------------------+
| Field             | Value                                     |
+-------------------+-------------------------------------------+
| Description       |                                           |
| Egress Policy ID  | None                                      |
| ID                | c4b8f9d8-0da9-4ed5-a28b-320db1ed07d6      |
| Ingress Policy ID | cae01b16-c163-48be-9a3d-2e2b7724b1d3      |
| Name              | aaaa                                      |
| Ports             | [u'44c6d960-7e09-4735-a501-bfa024d52bde'] |
| Project           | 52f16f5e83a4494f83d30159cf41be7a          |
| Shared            | False                                     |
| State             | UP                                        |
| Status            | PENDING_UPDATE                            |
| project_id        | 52f16f5e83a4494f83d30159cf41be7a          |

That bothers me because if the group is stuck in this state no operations on the vm port can be performed because of "one port can be associated to only one firewall group exception". 

dev-user@iv-devstack-default-fwg:~/neutron_for_dummies/valley_of_lost_scripts$ openstack firewall group set mac_sg --port port100502
Failed to set firewall group 'mac_sg': Port(s) [u'44c6d960-7e09-4735-a501-bfa024d52bde'] provided already associated with other firewall group(s).
Neutron server returns request_ids: ['req-cb281ec6-f761-46e7-a377-ed6031c816df']'}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2017-10-13 17:36:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 67: Code-Review+1

Hi Inessa, I couldn't reproduce your situation.  However, I found a dual-execution issue.  Currently, if we try to execute following command at the same time, a port associates with different firewall_group.  I've tested with firewall_l2_driver are 'noop' or 'ovs' but the result was same.

* firewall group set fwg --port port-vm1
* firewall group set fwg2 --port port-vm1

In order to avoid completely, we need to add 'unique attribute' as 'port_id' in FirewallGroupPortAssociation table."}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2017-10-13 18:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 67:

Here is a command result: http://paste.openstack.org/show/623597/'}, {'account_id': 13702, 'date': '2017-10-14 01:03:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 67:

However, this issue is not related this patch.  I'll fix in another patch after Q-2."}, {'account_id': 13717, 'date': '2017-10-14 10:45:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 67: -Code-Review

I'll remove -1 then and continue investigating on my own."}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2017-10-16 03:54:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 67:

'}, {'created': '2017-05-19 10:24:00.000000000', 'message': "FWaaS v2 extension for L2 agent

This patch adds L2 agent extension for FWaaS v2 and enable to handle
port and firewall resources behavior as follows:
[Behaviors]
  * Apply default firewall group for VM port
  * Update a status of firewall group
  * Call driver's function in order to configure firewall rule
  * Update an association between ports and firewall groups

[Triggers]
  * VM port is created
  * VM port is deleted
  * Firewall group is created
  * Firewall group is updated
  * Firewall group is deleted

Co-Authored-By: Paddu Krishnan <kprad1@yahoo.com>
Co-Authored-By: Chandan Dutta Chowdhury <chandanc@juniper.net>
Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0
Change-Id: I9f172be46ee590b99313106fa262019a2583774a

"}, {'created': '2017-08-02 06:21:09.000000000', 'message': "FWaaS v2 extension for L2 agent

This patch adds L2 agent extension for FWaaS v2 and enable to handle
port and firewall resources behavior as follows:
[Behaviors]
  * Apply default firewall group for VM port
  * Update a status of firewall group
  * Call driver's function in order to configure firewall rule
  * Update an association between ports and firewall groups

[Triggers]
  * VM port is created
  * VM port is deleted
  * Firewall group is created
  * Firewall group is updated
  * Firewall group is deleted

Co-Authored-By: Paddu Krishnan <kprad1@yahoo.com>
Co-Authored-By: Chandan Dutta Chowdhury <chandanc@juniper.net>
Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0
Change-Id: I9f172be46ee590b99313106fa262019a2583774a

"}, {'created': '2017-08-10 14:06:13.000000000', 'message': "FWaaS v2 extension for L2 agent

This patch adds L2 agent extension for FWaaS v2 and enable to handle
port and firewall resources behavior as follows:
- Behaviors
  * Apply default firewall group for VM port
  * Update a status of firewall group
  * Call driver's function in order to configure firewall rule
  * Update an association between ports and firewall groups

- Triggers
  * VM port is created
  * VM port is deleted
  * Firewall group is created
  * Firewall group is updated
  * Firewall group is deleted

- How to enable
  Please add following definition in
  /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
  [fwaas]
  enable_l2 = True (Default is False)

Co-Authored-By: Paddu Krishnan <kprad1@yahoo.com>
Co-Authored-By: Chandan Dutta Chowdhury <chandanc@juniper.net>
Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0
Change-Id: I9f172be46ee590b99313106fa262019a2583774a

commit_message:
FWaaS v2 extension for L2 agent

This patch adds L2 agent extension for FWaaS v2 to handle
create/update/delete firewall groups on ports. It also
handles applying firewall group on port, when a port is
added/created/deleted.

DocImpact

Depends-On:  Ifd6758617ab8fd49e69ad1a0483fefa479d7b8e7
Co-Authored-By: Paddu Krishnan <kprad1@yahoo.com>

Co-Authored-By: Nguyen Phuong An <AnNP@vn.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: Inessa Vasilevskaya <ivasilevskaya@mirantis.com>
Partial-Implements: blueprint fwaas-api-2.0
Change-Id: I9f172be46ee590b99313106fa262019a2583774a

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 16:23:09.000000000', 'message': "zuul: remove file rule for ovb-ha

It was a bad idea because now we run ovb-ha only when we touch this
file. We don't want that. In fact, we have a irrelevant-files list in
tripleo-ci that we should improve if we know some files that have no
impact on ovb-ha.

This patch remove the file rule, so we run the job again on THT unless a
patch only touch irrelevant-files.

Change-Id: I7a2f8791bf52c2251bd8e13100fd2d50632008fc
"}]
commit_message:
zuul: remove file rule for ovb-ha

It was a bad idea because now we run ovb-ha only when we touch this
file. We don't want that. In fact, we have a irrelevant-files list in
tripleo-ci that we should improve if we know some files that have no
impact on ovb-ha.

This patch remove the file rule, so we run the job again on THT unless a
patch only touch irrelevant-files.

Change-Id: I7a2f8791bf52c2251bd8e13100fd2d50632008fc

commit_message:
add support for legacy command name translation

Add add_legacy_command() method to the command manager and update the
command search logic to try translating the old legacy name to the new
name.

Change-Id: I0c0cdbfcb1612ec3975864fc7f730ff186879027
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix 500 from image-import on 'active' image

If you run image-import api on any image which is in active state
will return 500 error as it raises InvalidImageStatusTransition
because Image status transition from active to importing is not allowed.

Caught InvalidImageStatusTransition exception in controller and raised
HTTConflict exception to return HTTP 409 error to the user.

Change-Id: I3ed1e40122063fe563ba27b7b7db07f62bef2382
Closes-Bug: #1733803

commit_message:
Fix 500 from stage call on non-existing image

If user tries to stage data to unexisting image then it fails with 500
internal server error.

Caught NotFound exception and raised HTTPNotFound to return 404
response to the user.

Change-Id: I78d252fceb9a5537135f0c238c4ad2ba52fdda7c
Closes-Bug: #1733551

commit_message:
Remove parameter metadata_port_ip

Currently, all arguments of metadata_port_ip are got by
_find_metadata_port_ip and then passed, it's unnecessary.
We can remove this parameter from all functions and only leave it in
_get_ovn_dhcpv4_opts.

Change-Id: Ibb87a0b5e3cc414a4a7b1bc67a9de4d9dd14d033
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ie7c06ead39c8597ec9326f223625d1fa0d5208d1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-24 11:33:51.000000000', 'message': 'Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

As explained in bug [1] when l3 agent fails to report state to the
server, its state is set to AGENT_REVIVED, triggering
fetch_and_sync_all_routers, which will set all its HA network ports
to DOWN, resulting in
1) ovs agent rewiring these ports and setting status to ACTIVE
2) when these ports are active, server sends router update to l3 agent
As server, ovs and l3 agents are busy with this processing, l3 agent
may fail again reporting state, repeating this process.

As l3 agent is repeatedly processing same routers, SIGHUPs are
frequently sent to keepalived, resulting in multiple masters.

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent
start instead of calling from fetch_and_sync_all_routers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1731595/comments/7

Change-Id: Ia9d5549f7d53b538c9c9f93fe6aa71ffff15524a
Related-bug: #1597461
Closes-Bug: #1731595
(cherry picked from commit 9ab1ad1433d54fec3e5b04f1edf8ca436e1f7af1)
'}, {'created': '2017-12-01 06:10:56.000000000', 'message': 'Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

As explained in bug [1] when l3 agent fails to report state to the
server, its state is set to AGENT_REVIVED, triggering
fetch_and_sync_all_routers, which will set all its HA network ports
to DOWN, resulting in
1) ovs agent rewiring these ports and setting status to ACTIVE
2) when these ports are active, server sends router update to l3 agent
As server, ovs and l3 agents are busy with this processing, l3 agent
may fail again reporting state, repeating this process.

As l3 agent is repeatedly processing same routers, SIGHUPs are
frequently sent to keepalived, resulting in multiple masters.

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent
start instead of calling from fetch_and_sync_all_routers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1731595/comments/7

Change-Id: Ia9d5549f7d53b538c9c9f93fe6aa71ffff15524a
Related-bug: #1597461
Closes-Bug: #1731595
(cherry picked from commit 9ed693228f90251c0f03fb842ef19628b439f9bc)
'}]
commit_message:
Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

As explained in bug [1] when l3 agent fails to report state to the
server, its state is set to AGENT_REVIVED, triggering
fetch_and_sync_all_routers, which will set all its HA network ports
to DOWN, resulting in
1) ovs agent rewiring these ports and setting status to ACTIVE
2) when these ports are active, server sends router update to l3 agent
As server, ovs and l3 agents are busy with this processing, l3 agent
may fail again reporting state, repeating this process.

As l3 agent is repeatedly processing same routers, SIGHUPs are
frequently sent to keepalived, resulting in multiple masters.

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent
start instead of calling from fetch_and_sync_all_routers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1731595/comments/7

Change-Id: Ia9d5549f7d53b538c9c9f93fe6aa71ffff15524a
Related-bug: #1597461
Closes-Bug: #1731595
(cherry picked from commit 9ed693228f90251c0f03fb842ef19628b439f9bc)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 16:28:47.000000000', 'message': "Make py27 and py35 versions and template of unit-tips jobs

Make py27 and py35 versions of the tips job, and a project-template to
hold them so it's easy for other projects to use both (or more, we ever
add them) The base tox job knows how to install siblings based on
required-projects, which makes it easy to piggyback on them.

Remove the irrelevant-files sections, as these are specified in the
base openstack-tox jobs.

Using the unit-tips or functional-tips tox env is no longer neccessary.
For the gate it's actually important to not do the sibling processing by
hand in tox as the base tox job version of the logic does all the
right things to deal with constraints and whatnot. Leave them for local
developer convenience.

Leave the osc-tox-unit-tips job for now, since there are some other
repos using it. Once we switch them to the template, we can remove the
job.

Change-Id: I599b18218c10cb08e508cca3b3bbc9c88b8f809c
"}]
commit_message:
Make py27 and py35 versions and template of unit-tips jobs

Make py27 and py35 versions of the tips job, and a project-template to
hold them so it's easy for other projects to use both (or more, we ever
add them) The base tox job knows how to install siblings based on
required-projects, which makes it easy to piggyback on them.

Remove the irrelevant-files sections, as these are specified in the
base openstack-tox jobs.

Using the unit-tips or functional-tips tox env is no longer neccessary.
For the gate it's actually important to not do the sibling processing by
hand in tox as the base tox job version of the logic does all the
right things to deal with constraints and whatnot. Leave them for local
developer convenience.

Leave the osc-tox-unit-tips job for now, since there are some other
repos using it. Once we switch them to the template, we can remove the
job.

Change-Id: I599b18218c10cb08e508cca3b3bbc9c88b8f809c

commit_message:
Fix race in delete allocation in ServerMovingTests

When an instance is deleted the allocation of that instance is freed
after the instance is destroyed in the db. The functional tests that
asserting resource allocation after instance delete are waiting for
the instance to disappear from the REST API. This made such tests
racy.

Fortunately the instance.delete.end notification is emitted after
the instance allocation is freed. This patch fixes the race in the
test by waiting for the instance.delete.end notification before
asserting that the allocation is freed properly.

Change-Id: I4ffd8eae73600eb2d4f6929ee6a7768adb80081d
Closes-Bug: #1719915
(cherry picked from commit 8a435c081df1653620cff5918ea66643d3487fd7)

It is used with "if existing_instance()", existing_instance return " os.environ.get("TESTS_USE_INSTANCE_ID", None)". Could this be the reason(TESTS_USE_INSTANCE_ID=None) that we did't meet the failing tests? I will work on this, try to find the reason. 
By the way, I found this during my learning trove code, not in practice.'}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-06-02 12:55:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

I'm marking this WF-1 to highlight that there's something here that we don't quite understand and that this patch still will be worked on by the author to get to the bottom of the issues.

THANK YOU for the change, and thanks for finding it by inspection. I think we should fix this once we understand this issue better."}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2017-06-02 12:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > tests? I will work on this, try to find the reason.
 > By the way, I found this during my learning trove code, not in
 > practice.

I don't think that's the reason. There is a comment describing why we set the instance ID to None, and its to reuse existing instances (instead of creating new ones) because creating instances takes some time.

Its great you want to learn the code, but I find it funny you want to figure why a test is not failing. :) I'm trying to triage some low-hanging-fruit bugs for you... but its taking a while.'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2017-06-02 12:57:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

oh, I see there is something to look into here, thanks."}, {'account_id': 9664, 'date': '2017-09-27 01:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow

As such, I think a simpler fix would simply be to remove the 'name' variable from the message.  If this is ever hit during a test run the stack would still point to whether an  user was being looked up by tenant or name, as well as the calling code."}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2017-11-24 08:44:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > by tenant or name, as well as the calling code.

hi samuel, sorry late to see your comments.
I have check the two method and they are exist in trove from very begining. I agree with you that the code is never hit because "if exist_instance()"  is always false with normal processing. 
Your advise is just like my patch set 1 and I will update the patch again.'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2017-11-24 09:04:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2017-11-30 02:13:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Unuse an undefined local variable 'name'.

trove/tests/utils/users.py: _find_user_by_condition
In expect code, the error message use an undefined
variable 'name' and this will raise a NameError.

Change-Id: I05cc16f865ef2ca73466aa165284975964680f8a
Closes-Bug: 1681309

commit_message:
SFC plugin: preserve chain order in set/unset commands

Port pair groups order must be kept so we cannot use a set to filter
duplicates. Else this will change the chain order

Also fixed for flow classifiers: though loosing the order does not
currently trigger a visible change, this restores the neutron CLI
behaviour

Expand help messages to mention the port pair groups order

Change-Id: Ia6e342fda2c739a3553a8736837bcacf00a2d030
Closes-Bug: #1724187

commit_message:
Fix directory tree appearance in document

This commit fixes the directory tree appearance in document. It looks
like that the original rst line blocks don't work in the current
renderer. As a result, the directory structure is a little difficult to
understand. So, this commit use a literal block instead of that as a
quick fix.

Change-Id: I897cec40cc1ee5ead50997e75c474e1f78ee763e

[{'created': '2017-09-26 13:29:17.000000000', 'message': 'SFC plugin: fix dictionary parameters

Service function parameters could not be set on a port pair, and "None"
correlation value was not accepted

Chain parameters were passed incorrectly to server on a port chain

On a port pair group, lb_fields parameter requires an underscore

Also fix related unit tests

Change-Id: Ie60c609b8d33731a7fed732d97ed92982523956b
Closes-Bug: #1719584

commit_message:
SFC plugin: fix dictionary parameters

Service function parameters could not be set on a port pair, and "None"
correlation value was not accepted

Chain parameters were passed incorrectly to server on a port chain

On a port pair group, lb_fields must be passed to the API with an
underscore

Fix check on empty dictionary parameters (we get [], not None)

Also fix related unit tests

Change-Id: Ie60c609b8d33731a7fed732d97ed92982523956b
Closes-Bug: #1719584

[{'created': '2017-09-14 14:01:20.000000000', 'message': 'SFC plugin: fix port chain set commands

Setting a flow classifier or port pair group currently fails,
additionally with multiple flow classifiers only the last one is added

* Rename all list_ functions to follow the expected naming format
expected by find_resource() calls: "list_%s" % cmd_resource_plural
* Fix adding multiple items in the same command
* Update unit test to try setting multiple flow classifiers

Change-Id: Ifbc24d84022c9893d3348fb27b20206fa464d8b2
Closes-Bug: #1716942

commit_message:
SFC plugin: fix port chain set commands

Setting a flow classifier or port pair group currently fails,
additionally with multiple flow classifiers only the last one is added

* Fix adding multiple items in the same command
* Update unit test to try setting multiple flow classifiers

Change-Id: Ifbc24d84022c9893d3348fb27b20206fa464d8b2
Closes-Bug: #1716942

commit_message:
Additional volume quota set RBAC tests

This PS adds additional volume quota set RBAC tests for the
following endpoints:

  * '/os-quota-sets/{project_id}' [0]
  * '/os-quota-sets/{project_id}/default' [0]
  * '/os-quota-sets/{project_id}' [1]

This PS also adds a clean up to test_update_quota_set
so that the default quotas are reset following test
execution.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/10a3f4e1c6f21effc79fd309628111c221543e0d/cinder/policies/quotas.py#L28

commit_message:
Use 'PermitRootLogin 'without-password''

Since https://review.openstack.org/#/c/518013/7 merged we can now set
the value of security_sshd_permit_root_login to be 'without-password',
we should do this in favour of 'yes'.

[hwoarang: This also bumps a-r-r to include the fix in the
ansible-hardening role]

Change-Id: I624d29752fca5a8cbf4cab455f32f0116b99ff82
(cherry picked from commit d78e63a67db98e72778fb33256d800f898e982ec)

commit_message:
Use tests repo for all lint tests

The lint tests are inconsistent and often timing out due to
the implementation not using the cached repositories in the
same way as the tests repo's lint tests.

It'll be simpler to maintain if all lint tests worked the
same way.

Depends-On: I8bea90082dbde7de49c5e2e86d298c017b16591d
Change-Id: I4a5f6fe69e2d421846999c7cbd949504be77f23d
(cherry picked from commit f3dccff4ea40b498c09954ad6b9c2a6c40f95bea)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 11:22:22.000000000', 'message': "Do not use lsns to kill non-containerized epmd on the host

In a containerized HA environment, the Erlang port mapper daemon is
started via pacemaker. If an epmd runs on the host, it must be killed
to prevent it from holding the epmd port.

The current way of searching for non-containerized epmd is broken in
case lsns returns an error. Use pgrep's namespace filtering instead.

Change-Id: I29d451716c8e955b9e114a289ac1e22d2af35f1a
Closes-Bug: #1735698
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use lsns to kill non-containerized epmd on the host

In a containerized HA environment, the Erlang port mapper daemon is
started via pacemaker. If an epmd runs on the host, it must be killed
to prevent it from holding the epmd port.

The current way of searching for non-containerized epmd is broken in
case lsns returns an error. Use pgrep's namespace filtering instead.

Change-Id: I29d451716c8e955b9e114a289ac1e22d2af35f1a
Closes-Bug: #1735698

commit_message:
Consume the OSC unit-tips job

Swap in OSC's osc-tox-unit-tips for the local cliff-tox-openstackclient-tips
job.  The OSC job runs agains master for the following:
* python-openstackclient
* python-openstacksdk
* os-client-config
* osc-lib

Leave the integration-tests/openstackclient-tips.sh script in place as it is
still udeful locally, although it should probably be updated to install all
of the above projects from master.

Depends-On: I5acdcb0a2f0f0dfe488740ae0add36366cc0ee21
Change-Id: I60fc81c1aac19a753b76fc30ce13c4365d16b815

subject: Add OSC functional-tips job to check pipeline
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-27 14:26:23.000000000', 'message': "Add OSC functional-tips job to check pipeline

The osc-functional-devstack-tips job runs unit tests only, and only
installs python-openstackclient from master.  We really need to include
osc-lib as much of the cliff interfaces in OSC are there.

Also, since unit tests often mock things out from other packages, the
functional tests are better at finding integration issues.  OSC has some
'integration' tests in its unit test suite that use the full client stack,
mocking out calls at the HTTP REST layer so those are still useful too.

We will add a unit test -tips style job to OSC that can be consumed here.

Change-Id: Id9d1990e240a44c06d186c50c5f55e645b265020
"}]
commit_message:
Add OSC functional-tips job to check pipeline

The osc-functional-devstack-tips job runs unit tests only, and only
installs python-openstackclient from master.  We really need to include
osc-lib as much of the cliff interfaces in OSC are there.

Also, since unit tests often mock things out from other packages, the
functional tests are better at finding integration issues.  OSC has some
'integration' tests in its unit test suite that use the full client stack,
mocking out calls at the HTTP REST layer so those are still useful too.

We will add a unit test -tips style job to OSC that can be consumed here.

Change-Id: Id9d1990e240a44c06d186c50c5f55e645b265020

commit_message:
Manual testing scripts

Add to repo so developers can use the scripts
in manual testing as well as contribute additional scripts.

One step toward systematic pre-release QA.
Closes-Bug: 1651926

Backport: testing-only change

Change-Id: I1dc7cea2fd3b56d838ae19bd6ef854fcc4b48c8e
(cherry picked from commit aafdc9ba42bfdf516a09db29b2ebb3c3e9120222)

is an easy win.

commit_message:
Adding 'latest' to known_hash_tags

since default is latest, known_hash_tags should have it or else
oooq fails at roles/repo-setup/tasks/get-dlrn-hash.yml#L6-L7

Change-Id: I25b722df887d717b4d9b3f3dac50b3f2ad5ddfb2

commit_message:
Added NovaMigrationTarget service to OVS-DPDK role

The service NovaMigrationTarget is missing in DPDK compute role,
but is required for migration of instances. Added the missing
service to the role.
Partial-Bug: #1730275

Change-Id: I1b51af450d6fcc36d57398e9ee3f2c3e73924e7f
(cherry picked from commit 3ebcb8eeada967f616219bf84620fe7cefcdc48b)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I0b36f95fa92f15159156815bc6d8e1add8902182

messages: [{'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2017-11-29 19:35:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2017-11-29 19:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2017-11-29 19:37:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nIs there a better way to disable this from tls everywhere?'}, {'account_id': 6924, 'date': '2017-12-01 21:41:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 19:35:45.000000000', 'message': 'Disable tls for redis

Redis replication does not work correctly with tls enabled.
Lets split out redis from global EnableInternalTLS param
so it doesnt get turned on with rest of the services.

Closes-bug: #1735259

Change-Id: Ifeb8ee9313d353a773c78ed72961e33e407ea961
'}]
commit_message:
Disable tls for redis

Redis replication does not work correctly with tls enabled.
Lets split out redis from global EnableInternalTLS param
so it doesnt get turned on with rest of the services.

Closes-bug: #1735259

Change-Id: Ifeb8ee9313d353a773c78ed72961e33e407ea961

commit_message:
Add OvS-NSH support

To be able to perform SFC through NSH
protocol special Openvswitch packages are needed.

Blueprint: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/476121/

Change-Id: Id0e22067ac5d2a33aa2150dd65ac3fb9ae7c7542
Signed-off-by: Dimitrios Markou <mardim@intracom-telecom.com>

commit_message:
Use Sphinx 1.5 warning-is-error

With pbr 2.0 and Sphinx 1.5, the setting for treat sphinx warnings as
errors is setting warning-is-error in build_sphinx section. Enable this

Change-Id: I3712c681cedae30c189d975f6b319e278c1bd419

commit_message:
Complete move of baremetal machine tests

Migrating tests to wrap up machine actions.

Ports will be migrated separately as there
will also need to be portgroups, which could
be wrapped into the same file/class depending
on how that ends up being implemented.

Change-Id: I239bbc134f42a47e8df75531dbd50916a97a6068

commit_message:
Add method to cleanup autocreated image objects

This shouldn't really be needed, as the objects should get cleaned up
automatically. BUT - if things leak, this method can be used to delete
any objects shade has uploaded on behalf of the user for deleting
images.

While in there, clean up test_image to use a few more good practices.

Change-Id: Ifb697944856e1922517074d84a7c00a4af75b1e6

commit_message:
Cleanup objects that we create on behalf of images

When the use performs create_image on a cloud that requires the image be
uploaded to swift, we upload the image content to swift for them. Once
the image is imported, the content in swift is no longer needed as
glance copies the data into its own area. Clean the images up so that
we're not just accumulating tons of content in swift.

Change-Id: Iede6441c0cad1d99e92fdfacf96d81aad479a93e

commit_message:
Remove openstack-tox-pypy jobs

Now subunit is bombing out in crazy ways. This is too much effort for a
thing nobody uses.

commit_message:
Images: Neutron service specific explicit image names

This patch set makes the service-specific images for neutron
have explicit names, allowing simple over-riding of images
for an entire site.

[{'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-11-15 14:16:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-11-15 16:13:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So in general this is fine, but as it is it is racy because we have no guarantee that rabbitmq is up when rabbitmq_users are created. Even adding a subsequent puppet step like in the non-ha case is racy. We probably need the same approach as we are doing for galera with the exec galera-ready thing. We prototyped something in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520119/ to achieve this. Will report back once we test that'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-11-15 16:23:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Another option would be that I could modify this to simply use docker_puppet_tasks via the pacemaker service. Perhaps running it at 'step 2' though. This would create the custom rabbit users after step 2 executes in a similar ephemeral rabbitmq initialization container on the bootstrap node:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/docker/services/rabbitmq.yaml#n201"}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2017-11-15 16:33:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Michele:
 > 
 > Another option would be that I could modify this to simply use
 > docker_puppet_tasks via the pacemaker service. Perhaps running it


I don't think this is possible, I remember we did not use the docker_puppet_tasks initially because it was running puppet on all the nodes which are hosting the service. With HA deployment that would call the init tasks many times concurrently whereas we would need to run it only once.

 > at 'step 2' though. This would create the custom rabbit users after
 > step 2 executes in a similar ephemeral rabbitmq initialization
 > container on the bootstrap node:
 > 
 > http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/docker/services/rabbitmq.yaml#n201"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-11-15 20:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Damien: we made it so that docker_puppet_tasks only runs on the bootstrap_node_id

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/tree/common/deploy-steps.j2#n254'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-11-16 06:17:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > Michele:
 > >
 > > Another option would be that I could modify this to simply use
 > > docker_puppet_tasks via the pacemaker service. Perhaps running it
 > 
 > 
 > I don't think this is possible, I remember we did not use the
 > docker_puppet_tasks initially because it was running puppet on all
 > the nodes which are hosting the service. With HA deployment that
 > would call the init tasks many times concurrently whereas we would
 > need to run it only once.

I think the main issue is that even if you do it at a later step you're still
not explicitly guaranteed that rabbit is up enough to create users. 
 

 > > at 'step 2' though. This would create the custom rabbit users
 > after
 > > step 2 executes in a similar ephemeral rabbitmq initialization

So I un-WIP-ed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/520119/. revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 14:16:30.000000000', 'message': "Run rabbitmq_policy,rabbitmq_user with pacemaker

When using the docker/services/pacemaker/rabbitmq.yaml service
it appears that custom rabbit users and policies aren't being
initialized.

For non-pacemaker containerized rabbit this typically occurs
in the docker_puppet_tasks. With pacemaker enabled however we
are doing this sort of initialization via the _init_bundle
container.

This causes issues for some integrations (Veritas) that require
extra rabbit users.

Change-Id: I521c7468ef3677ebfd645f609c0b76ba30df7c86
"}]
commit_message:
Run rabbitmq_policy,rabbitmq_user with pacemaker

When using the docker/services/pacemaker/rabbitmq.yaml service
it appears that custom rabbit users and policies aren't being
initialized.

For non-pacemaker containerized rabbit this typically occurs
in the docker_puppet_tasks. With pacemaker enabled however we
are doing this sort of initialization via the _init_bundle
container.

This causes issues for some integrations (Veritas) that require
extra rabbit users.

Change-Id: I521c7468ef3677ebfd645f609c0b76ba30df7c86

commit_message:
Images: Magnum service specific explicit image names

This patch set makes the service-specific images for magnum
have explicit names, allowing simple over-riding of images
for an entire site.

Change-Id: I6d1dfe6bbd5a0911cc176958b932aaaf31131620

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Id5b1b0d8815c8324c53eca0fb9a32b1495617eba

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Iabdecab91b8f539500f73cf124e99ce0ee8f2bff

commit_message:
Adds the user's project id to the VIP port creation

This brings Octavia in line with what n-lbaas does for VIP port and
allows a user to attach a FIP to the VIP port generated by Octavia.

Change-Id: Ib7e6374cad49a16a733dacb2ea1ca096d8c4e6e4
(cherry picked from commit 0f4a5e21709c77c926cbbf7929217fa951b48ad7)

commit_message:
Fix the failover API to not fail with immutable LB

A patch was added[1] that put an immutable check in the amphora failover
flow. However, when failover was triggered by the failover API, the load
balancer was already in PENDING_UPDATE. This caused the flow to fail and the
load balancer to be left in ERROR. This patch resolves those two code paths
to handle the load balancer locking the same.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/479109/

Change-Id: I6c8549c15a302add8c69ab95bde57fb2646455b6

commit_message:
Enable worker and producer by default in devstack

In devstack settings we have pool-manager and zone-manager
enabled by default. This causes conflict if a user wants to run
designate plugin with worker and producer.

This change replaces pool-manager and zone-manager with worker
and producer in devstack settings.

Closes-Bug: #1733992

Change-Id: Id96f1430d1091f2485099523fae499bde377e7e6

[{'created': '2017-11-30 21:37:23.000000000', 'message': 'sub-package api converters

This patch starts a neutron_lib.api.converters sub-package to allow API
defintions the ability to create converters spcific to their defintion
(for example the convert_protocol in [1]). All generic converters will
remain in neutron_lib.api.converters.__init__ which is backwards
compatibile. This is the same approach we took with validators.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/extensions/securitygroup.py

Change-Id: Ide680cba4012bb1abd8864c7cc8d1c9a67f39c21
'}]
commit_message:
sub-package api converters

This patch starts a neutron_lib.api.converters sub-package to allow API
defintions the ability to create converters spcific to their defintion
(for example the convert_protocol in [1]). All generic converters will
remain in neutron_lib.api.converters.__init__ which is backwards
compatibile. This is the same approach we took with validators.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/extensions/securitygroup.py

Change-Id: Ide680cba4012bb1abd8864c7cc8d1c9a67f39c21

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 23:10:02.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Test minimum unbound TTL for TripleO jobs

Change-Id: Iab9f4426304fab6b9e6f0920ad5c4e3b94d74954
'}, {'created': '2017-11-30 19:01:04.000000000', 'message': "Enforce a minimum TTL for DNS records in TripleO jobs

We have reasons to believe there is a correlation between DNS lookup
failures we are seeing in the gate and the very low TTL of some
domains.

Since jobs are running on ephemeral nodes which wouldn't be impacted
by stale cache, enforce a minimum TTL of 900 (15 minutes) for DNS
records in the local Unbound configuration.
This means that a domain with a TTL of 60 seconds will be cached for
15 minutes instead.

This will lead to less queries which is less prone to failure and rate
limiting by recursive DNS providers.

Change-Id: Iab9f4426304fab6b9e6f0920ad5c4e3b94d74954
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce a minimum TTL for DNS records in TripleO jobs

We have reasons to believe there is a correlation between DNS lookup
failures we are seeing in the gate and the very low TTL of some
domains.

Since jobs are running on ephemeral nodes which wouldn't be impacted
by stale cache, enforce a minimum TTL of 900 (15 minutes) for DNS
records in the local Unbound configuration.
This means that a domain with a TTL of 60 seconds will be cached for
15 minutes instead.

This will lead to less queries which is less prone to failure and rate
limiting by recursive DNS providers.

Change-Id: Iab9f4426304fab6b9e6f0920ad5c4e3b94d74954

commit_message:
Move Kubespray job from experimental to check

We've seen it passing, time to move from experimental to non-voting
check job. It's still restricted to run only on changing the specified
files.

commit_message:
Add cliff and keystoneauth to tips jobs

Both of these can severely break openstackclient. Add them to the
required-projects list of the tips jobs. We should then add at least
osc-tox-unit-tips but maybe also osc-functional-devstack-tips to both
cliff and keystoneauth so that it's symmetrical.

Change-Id: Ie0f3e9d7e221c9cdd3c5d726148f456246186ff4

commit_message:
Refined fix for validating image on rebuild

This aims to fix the issue described in bug 1664931 where a rebuild
fails to validate the existing host with the scheduler when a new
image is provided. The previous attempt to do this could cause rebuilds
to fail unnecessarily because we ran _all_ of the filters during a
rebuild, which could cause usage/resource filters to prevent an otherwise
valid rebuild from succeeding.

This aims to classify filters as useful for rebuild or not, and only apply
the former during a rebuild scheduler check. We do this by using an internal
scheduler hint, indicating our intent. This should (a) filter out
all hosts other than the one we're running on and (b) be detectable by
the filtering infrastructure as an internally-generated scheduling request
in order to trigger the correct filtering behavior.

Conflicts:
      nova/scheduler/utils.py
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts are due to not having
7d0381c91a6ba8a45ae6527f046f382166eb158d or
4a7502a5c9e84a8c8cef7f355d72425b26b8c379 in Newton.

Closes-Bug: #1664931
Change-Id: I1a46ef1503be2febcd20f4594f44344d05525446
(cherry picked from commit f7c688b8ef88a7390f5b09719a2b3e80368438c0)
(cherry picked from commit b29a461a8bc05c9b171c0574abb2e7e5b62a2ed7)
(cherry picked from commit bbfc4230efe3299fa51f9451f54062f32590ed3d)

commit_message:
Refined fix for validating image on rebuild

This aims to fix the issue described in bug 1664931 where a rebuild
fails to validate the existing host with the scheduler when a new
image is provided. The previous attempt to do this could cause rebuilds
to fail unnecessarily because we ran _all_ of the filters during a
rebuild, which could cause usage/resource filters to prevent an otherwise
valid rebuild from succeeding.

This aims to classify filters as useful for rebuild or not, and only apply
the former during a rebuild scheduler check. We do this by using an internal
scheduler hint, indicating our intent. This should (a) filter out
all hosts other than the one we're running on and (b) be detectable by
the filtering infrastructure as an internally-generated scheduling request
in order to trigger the correct filtering behavior.

Conflicts:
      nova/scheduler/filters/exact_core_filter.py
      nova/scheduler/filters/exact_disk_filter.py
      nova/scheduler/filters/exact_ram_filter.py
      nova/scheduler/filters/type_filter.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflicts were due to deprecation warnings
which don't exist in Ocata. The functional test also needed a missing
import and to use api_put() instead of put_service().

Closes-Bug: #1664931
Change-Id: I1a46ef1503be2febcd20f4594f44344d05525446
(cherry picked from commit f7c688b8ef88a7390f5b09719a2b3e80368438c0)
(cherry picked from commit b29a461a8bc05c9b171c0574abb2e7e5b62a2ed7)

Redis replication does not work with TLS

Lets revert the tls support until we know it works.

Revert "TLS proxy for redis"

This reverts commit c2a93cf4c5d9d6b5ee0536380751a7a9540927cc.

Closes-bug: #1735259

commit_message:
Introduce TRIPLEO_HEAT_TEMPLATES_ROOT

Removing hardcoded /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates. This allows
operator to specify TRIPLEO_HEAT_TEMPLATES_ROOT later. This is very helpful
when you have a scenario when undercloud is upgraded to N+1 version while
overcloud is still N version. Since /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates
is overrided the only way to test is to git clone -b stable/<version> and
export TRIPLEO_HEAT_TEMPLATES_ROOT. This will allow operator to test overcloud
before upgrade procedure.

Change-Id: I69490b555cb1ef2a21313a6fac1eee4fa1a33423

commit_message:
Make sure we collect var/lib/heat-config directory.

This collect /var/lib/heat-config as it can be useful to see how the
script were rendered.

It includes the deployed/<hash>.json as it contains information about
which heat resource triggered the script.

Change-Id: I98937eff257509bda98888534b7a1cd33595315f

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 20:08:58.000000000', 'message': "Refined fix for validating image on rebuild

This aims to fix the issue described in bug 1664931 where a rebuild
fails to validate the existing host with the scheduler when a new
image is provided. The previous attempt to do this could cause rebuilds
to fail unnecessarily because we ran _all_ of the filters during a
rebuild, which could cause usage/resource filters to prevent an otherwise
valid rebuild from succeeding.

This aims to classify filters as useful for rebuild or not, and only apply
the former during a rebuild scheduler check. We do this by using an internal
scheduler hint, indicating our intent. This should (a) filter out
all hosts other than the one we're running on and (b) be detectable by
the filtering infrastructure as an internally-generated scheduling request
in order to trigger the correct filtering behavior.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to the need to override the
_setup_scheduler_service method in Pike.

Closes-Bug: #1664931
Change-Id: I1a46ef1503be2febcd20f4594f44344d05525446
(cherry picked from commit 7f6ad3b80919d73ccffba7ef6ce0bfcc84d4a6c3)
"}, {'created': '2017-11-28 01:52:56.000000000', 'message': "Refined fix for validating image on rebuild

This aims to fix the issue described in bug 1664931 where a rebuild
fails to validate the existing host with the scheduler when a new
image is provided. The previous attempt to do this could cause rebuilds
to fail unnecessarily because we ran _all_ of the filters during a
rebuild, which could cause usage/resource filters to prevent an otherwise
valid rebuild from succeeding.

This aims to classify filters as useful for rebuild or not, and only apply
the former during a rebuild scheduler check. We do this by using an internal
scheduler hint, indicating our intent. This should (a) filter out
all hosts other than the one we're running on and (b) be detectable by
the filtering infrastructure as an internally-generated scheduling request
in order to trigger the correct filtering behavior.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to the need to override the
_setup_scheduler_service method in Pike.

Closes-Bug: #1664931
Change-Id: I1a46ef1503be2febcd20f4594f44344d05525446
(cherry picked from commit f7c688b8ef88a7390f5b09719a2b3e80368438c0)
"}]
commit_message:
Refined fix for validating image on rebuild

This aims to fix the issue described in bug 1664931 where a rebuild
fails to validate the existing host with the scheduler when a new
image is provided. The previous attempt to do this could cause rebuilds
to fail unnecessarily because we ran _all_ of the filters during a
rebuild, which could cause usage/resource filters to prevent an otherwise
valid rebuild from succeeding.

This aims to classify filters as useful for rebuild or not, and only apply
the former during a rebuild scheduler check. We do this by using an internal
scheduler hint, indicating our intent. This should (a) filter out
all hosts other than the one we're running on and (b) be detectable by
the filtering infrastructure as an internally-generated scheduling request
in order to trigger the correct filtering behavior.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to the need to override the
_setup_scheduler_service method in Pike.

Closes-Bug: #1664931
Change-Id: I1a46ef1503be2febcd20f4594f44344d05525446
(cherry picked from commit f7c688b8ef88a7390f5b09719a2b3e80368438c0)

commit_message:
zuul: run container jobs when touching puppet services

puppet services can break container jobs since they're still used by
docker services.

Change-Id: Ifdbede287b546a3b80086f56bc9bed95099ce433
(cherry picked from commit 995217f18eacaed3181b50bd9012828e48763669)

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I79e2aca1c61e4d1a36b82df447e0dc22fdad8cc3

commit_message:
Deprecate use_neutron option

Nova network has been fully removed from the OpenStack codebase.
As such, all instances of switches on use_neutron should be removed,
as the functionality will never be meaningful.

Change-Id: I4d9d21ea3b5090d4cb2822c0a95d819026578ccd
Depends-On: Ib9d87dd339d637b69fb27315d92228cbc523c8eb
Closes-Bug: #1734613

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 16:23:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix TLS everywhere containerized deployments

This commit fixes the command line that gets created when a TLS
everywhere deployment is requested.
We pass to the deploy command line th file named
docker-services-tls-everywhere.yam but this should not be used anymore.
It doesn't exists anymore upstream and in addition if it's declared on
the command line AFTER the docker-ha.yml all the HA stuff breaks and the
deploy fails, because it tries to deploy overcloud HA services as docker
but they need instead pacemaker bundles.

Change-Id: I4116f44643a397d96115e74c4979e51c41677368
"}]
commit_message:
Fix TLS everywhere containerized deployments

This commit fixes the command line that gets created when a TLS
everywhere deployment is requested.
We pass to the deploy command line th file named
docker-services-tls-everywhere.yam but this should not be used anymore.
It doesn't exists anymore upstream and in addition if it's declared on
the command line AFTER the docker-ha.yml all the HA stuff breaks and the
deploy fails, because it tries to deploy overcloud HA services as docker
but they need instead pacemaker bundles.

Change-Id: I4116f44643a397d96115e74c4979e51c41677368

commit_message:
Log consumer uuid when retrying claims in the scheduler

When creating multiple instances at once, if any of them
fail to claim in the scheduler due to conflicts when
allocations are posted, we need to know how many retries
we're doing and on which instances.

Change-Id: I49da04a87552a5ff093c48693cf2e433bcc4d319
(cherry picked from commit 852c3b6dfe3abe73aeaee048fbbd388ba6014e16)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 16:41:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix install-guide publishing

The ocata and earlier guides have been publishing to the service-type,
not the project-name. The Zuul v3 conversion broke this, restore this.

Note that this still results in some different names since we use the
services-type-authority now and formerly had hand-written assignments.

Change-Id: Ib03cc560868db725e151e0e8c9107846137f5d27
'}]
commit_message:
Fix install-guide publishing

The ocata and earlier guides have been publishing to the service-type,
not the project-name. The Zuul v3 conversion broke this, restore this.

Note that this still results in some different names since we use the
services-type-authority now and formerly had hand-written assignments.

Change-Id: Ib03cc560868db725e151e0e8c9107846137f5d27

commit_message:
Fix volume delete_group data race in clean up

Sometimes _delete_group in GroupsV3RbacTest fails because
there are still volumes attached to the group before group
deletion. This PS refactors _delete_group method to wait
for each volume belonging to the group to delete before
waiting for the group itself to delete.

Change-Id: I31483e91f55ea99f83310b37ed6f557aeec1c279

commit_message:
Correct policy names for volume metadata tests

This PS accomplishes 2 things:

1) Correct policy name for volume metadata tests that have the
wrong name. They are:
  * "volume:update_volume_metadata" ->
    "volume_extension:volume_image_metadata" [0]
  * "volume:delete_volume_metadata" ->
    "volume_extension:volume_image_metadata" [0]
2) Group together both the "volume_extension:volume_image_metadata"
   policy tests for easier readability/maintenance.\
3) Add cleanups to both tests.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/0ac4af182fdd55d4a97ce283070f7b8e6480540f/cinder/policies/volume_metadata.py#L98
[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/0ac4af182fdd55d4a97ce283070f7b8e6480540f/cinder/policies/volume_metadata.py#L106

Change-Id: Ie110283eca9decc37741b6197d0eb3f11d8918e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 09:21:58.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I1fc3059593b153d08a3ac80505a2881f4a36ddf5
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I1fc3059593b153d08a3ac80505a2881f4a36ddf5

cliff uses cliffdemo as a requirement for its tests and its doc builds.
Up until now it has been included as a sidecar via a line in tox.ini ...

commit_message:
Add cliffdemo

cliff uses cliffdemo as a requirement for its tests and its doc builds.
Up until now it has been included as a sidecar via a line in tox.ini ...
but with the move away from using tox for documentation builds, we're in
a pickle with how to install cliffdemo.

This adds it to global-requirements so that we can use normal
requirements declarations to indicate it's necessary.

Change-Id: I593105771611412c51c70e13a99df9e2acd3c186

commit_message:
[Fullstack] Fix destroy of VM fixture

When FakeFullstackMachine is connected to Linuxbridge
instead of Open vSwitch bridge, bridge object don't have
delete_port() method and it is not necessary to remove
"tap" device from host namespace.
This device will be removed together with deletion of
VM namespace.

Change-Id: I57a2ef84104b0951d77a8fc79265236d8d8dddf4
Closes-Bug: #1735571

commit_message:
Add pools attribute to load balancer heath monitor

The v2 api actually returns pools instead of pool_id in body,
but it still uses pool_id in the request.

Change-Id: I302537a33c4d48c702066439e566b423896fb70f

[{'created': '2017-11-16 19:45:18.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I809b833a8bf9616e22527f177ca9ed2c2fb059ca
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I809b833a8bf9616e22527f177ca9ed2c2fb059ca

commit_message:
cap gnocchiclient

current code uses interface attribute which was removed from
gnocchiclient>=4[1]. gnocchiclient==3.1.0 still works with
celometer(ocata)+gnocchi(4.1.1) integration

[1] 3b5648f6fa88f8c36eadb3a5729a4739788237fc

Closes-Bug: #1735577
Change-Id: I240fab9d804babff15b6d3363c938f9d82d0814e

You might consider re-implementing this using LibvirtMountedFileSystemVolumeDriver. NFS is currently the only consumer of that, but it was designed to be very easy to implement. This would resolve this race, and also allow you to safely implement unmount.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-11-22 14:06:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> You might consider re-implementing this using LibvirtMountedFileSystemVolumeDriver.
 > NFS is currently the only consumer of that, but it was designed to
 > be very easy to implement. This would resolve this race, and also
 > allow you to safely implement unmount.

Note though that necessitates not using os-brick any more. This doesn't sound like a bad thing, given the inability to disconnect"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-11-22 14:26:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

While I do think this would be better addressed by removing the use of os-brick and using LibvirtMountedFileSystemVolumeDriver, this is extra rework that would delay the actual bug fix getting in.

If you do have time to rework this, please do so and ping me to re-review. As things stand though, I'm happy enough with this fix to +2 it"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-30 19:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Vzstorage: synchronize volume connect

We need to protect the mount procedure
against possible races between requests
for volumes located on single Vzstorage share.
Disconnect is a no-op in os-brick's remotefs connector,
hence doesn't need this.

Change-Id: I26c61a85b5daa264cbb04b4497d9b6ac16e3f3a1
Closes-Bug: #1718474

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-22 03:31:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix TypeError of _get_project_id when project_id is None

If we get flavors with a domain token or an unscope token,
the project id of this case is None, will raise "TypeError:
'in <string>' requires string as left operand, not NoneType"
in _get_project_id. So, first we need check whether project_id
is None or not.

We can just return '' if project_id is None.

Change-Id: I8477d08a956a5b0262bd473254d9202738b6b65b
Closes-Bug: #1733746
'}]
commit_message:
Fix TypeError of _get_project_id when project_id is None

If we get flavors with a domain token or an unscope token,
the project id of this case is None, will raise "TypeError:
'in <string>' requires string as left operand, not NoneType"
in _get_project_id. So, first we need check whether project_id
is None or not.

We can just return '' if project_id is None.

Change-Id: I8477d08a956a5b0262bd473254d9202738b6b65b
Closes-Bug: #1733746

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Icdf31c157dba7018770502517ad6cee87b73c16f

commit_message:
Use in-tree cliffdemo app for docs build

Previously cliffdemo is specified as the dependency, but it installs
cliffdemo from PyPI which is older. It is better to build the doc
from the in-tree cliffdemo app.

Change-Id: I5821b52b05f257a82d7cae317bf75ea0c8455cf2

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-10-26 14:10:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

For now, I'm downgrading my vote until we have consensus about how it's going to be implemented in networking-ovn."}, {'account_id': 24654, 'date': '2017-11-01 12:25:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

 > its decision making.
 >

 > it's going to be implemented in networking-ovn.
@Moshe Thanks for the comment.
Hi Lucas,
I understand what Moshe meant in his comment. This is to address the following bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1713590
I am certain that we would hit the same issue with networking-ovn too.
I will update the patch and also will post a new comment explaining how scheduling etc is done with other details. Please note that it might take some time for updating the new patch as I am travelling to Sydney for the summit.:)"}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2017-11-01 13:09:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
SR-IOV support for a networking-ovn deployment

Networking-ovn ML2 mechanism driver now supports binding of
direct(SR-IOV) ports. Traffic Control(TC) hardware offload framework
for SR-IOV VFs was introduced in Linux kernel 4.8.
Open vSwitch(OVS) 2.8 supports offloading OVS datapath rules using
the TC framework. By using OVS version 2.8 and Linux kernel >= 4.8,
a SR-IOV VF can be controlled via Openflow control plane.

networking-ovn mech driver binds a vnic_direct port only when the user
requests --binding-profile '{"capabilities": ["switchdev"]}'. This is so
that networking-ovn and sriovnicswitch mech drivers works in the same set-up.
See [0] and [1] for more information.

[0] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1713590
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1719327

Implements: blueprint support-for-direct-vnic-type
Closes-Bug: 1515005
Change-Id: Icd0e36ece5f7a21f959840678c12a3aa6fd27f00
