revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-24 10:12:55.000000000', 'message': "Fix regex builder

Currently when the blacklist_file and regex string is provided,
the constructed regex looks like '^((?!black1|black2|...).)*$regex'.
This is incorrect, as it will match nothing - some string
is expected after end of the line [denoted as $ in the regex].

The proper construction is like ^(?!black1|black2|...).*(regex).*$
This solves the issue with Tempest, where using blacklist for smoke
tests is not working now, as it leads into the issue described above.

Change-Id: Icdeb3c311f7eb414158aedb4c030494b419211c0

commit_message:
Fix regex builder

Currently when the blacklist_file and regex string is provided,
the constructed regex looks like '^((?!black1|black2|...).)*$regex'.
This is incorrect, as it will match nothing - some string
is expected after end of the line [denoted as $ in the regex].

The proper construction is like ^(?!black1|black2|...).*(regex).*$
This solves the issue with Tempest, where using blacklist for smoke
tests is not working now, as it leads into the issue described above.

Change-Id: Icdeb3c311f7eb414158aedb4c030494b419211c0
Closes-Bug: #1506215
Closes-Bug: #1595119
Closes-Bug: #1622722
Closes-Bug: #1669455

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Ie2985abfafa71177b5800a8ca5a97381662bfea9

The instance should keep it's old image in the db once it has been unshelved, but it needs the new image because it will download it in the compute manager when it calls driver.spawn.

At the very least, we should put the actual image back to the instance once the unshelve is done, (so end of manager call).

Going forward, we might want to change what gets passed to spawn so that it can decide what to download. Keep in mind that right now we have the image as a block device in the db (even though we don't use it)"}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2014-02-11 18:10:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2014-02-10 16:14:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix: Unshelving an instance uses original image

When unshelving a shelved instance that has been offloaded
to glance it doesn't use the image stored in glance and uses
the image that the instance was booted up with in the first
place.

Change-Id: I3bba0a230044613e07122a6d122597e5b8d43438
Closes-Bug: #1257594
"}, {'created': '2014-02-10 17:10:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: Unshelving an instance uses original image

The driver use the property image_ref to boot the
the instance.
This patch updates the image_ref property with the
shelved_image_id stored during the shelving.

Change-Id: I3bba0a230044613e07122a6d122597e5b8d43438
Closes-Bug: #1257594
'}, {'created': '2014-02-13 11:15:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: Unshelving an instance uses original image

commit_message:
Fix: Unshelving an instance uses original image

The driver uses the property image_ref to boot the
the instance.
This patch updates the image_ref property with the
shelved_image_id stored during the shelving.

Change-Id: I3bba0a230044613e07122a6d122597e5b8d43438
Closes-Bug: #1257594

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I8732c7032bd45ce1186f3751f4953348ef4ef1cc

It introduced a race condition bug.

commit_message:
Ignore floating IP port for (create, update)_port

Creating/Updating LSP for floating IP is unnecessary in OVN.
It introduced a race condition bug.

Change-Id: I380686d21314095c39d7d1a2a4eea3e21dbe7c9d
Closes-bug: #1734819
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I9ee471b253ec104d2b93829be3644ce7aef06876

subject: Add support for reserved_host_cpus parameter
messages:
[{'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-28 20:28:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-29 08:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Why this instead of using config_template?'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-29 14:01:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I figured this one was important enough to have it as a variable. We might be able to utilize this in the gates.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-29 14:31:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I like it, and I actually appreciate the variable in this case. I'd almost say we should set a default of "1". While that's taking a core away from compute it is a sane default in most deployments which will help protect the compute node itself.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-29 15:56:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Well, it doesn't 'pin' a particular CPU, and it's still subject to vcpu overcommits. On an 8-core server, the scheduler will see it as a 7-core server -- that's all."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-01 03:20:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-12-01 15:54:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

I don't see a good reason to merge it.
In the long term I see more work, with no benefits.
Please enlighten me."}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-12-01 16:41:52.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I'll yield... ;) Perhaps I can turn this into a documentation item."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 20:28:51.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for reserved_host_cpus parameter

This patch adds support for the reserved_host_cpus parameter, which
allows deployers to prevent nova from using all of the available
CPUs on the hypervisor.

Closes-Bug: 1734995
Change-Id: I8abac8ea81bafebffae7c1dffa0181c46ef92314
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for reserved_host_cpus parameter

This patch adds support for the reserved_host_cpus parameter, which
allows deployers to prevent nova from using all of the available
CPUs on the hypervisor.

Closes-Bug: 1734995
Change-Id: I8abac8ea81bafebffae7c1dffa0181c46ef92314

commit_message:
Add shade and python-openstacksdk tips jobs

shade and python-openstacksdk both have unit and functional tips jobs
that are set up to tests against master of keystoneauth. Add them to the
mix.

Change-Id: Ie8d823b03586992b9cdac9236fe7d6d19dd9e821

commit_message:
Fix JSON generation when scenario has hooks

Patch the code according to hooks' internal structure. Generate
JSON report in `self` verification job.

Change-Id: Ia431460439473ab93fc2384054ede91bd02713e3
Closes-Bug: #1734336

commit_message:
fs001: run pingtest again

pingtest wasn't running since yesterday, when we migrated to the new ovb
minimal layout. This patch fixes it.

Also re-enable pingtest run by fixing jinja syntax.

Change-Id: Idf1686019752c6aebd39ae20047b4c0ae0074d86
Depends-On: I2881995d7156fb80eeffa81078e8f32f2668a6d5

commit_message:
Boot server from encrypted volume

This patch adds support for booting a server from an
encrypted volume while using luks encryption method.

Note: manager.create_server method passes wait_until='ACTIVE',
so 'create_test_server' function in common/compute.py waits
until the server status is 'ACTIVE'.

Change-Id: Ibd05252976499daaaafc658e3f3a920398b53420

commit_message:
gnocchi: mount the correct volume for /etc/ceph

During step4, /etc/ceph is the one of the host server instead
of the one generated by kolla.

This change uses the one generated by kolla and expose it to the
container.

(cherry picked from commit 6c1244d7a4210d120c020f10a3937430b5b933fe)
Closes-bug: #1734134
Change-Id: Ia1cca1c5d228ce0a3ef23a7c92f96a20ab958437

commit_message:
Remove reference to stable/pike from releasenotes

os-service-types is purposely branchless as it is a vessel to convey
current data (much like tzdata).

Remove stable/pike references from the releasenotes.

Change-Id: I27f13d21c37c49eb8119aa44a4bd46cab52846b6

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 12:26:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix ValueError when loading old pci device record

Old pci_devices records might not have a uuid value set
and when we load those out of the database, the
PciDevice._from_db_object code was blindly trying to set
the PciDevice.uuid field to None, which fails because the
PciDevice.uuid field is not nullable.

This change fixes the problem by skipping the 'uuid' field
if it's not set in the db record so that we can auto-generate
a uuid later and update the object with it, which also performs
our online data migration.

This is similar to how we handle the uuid online migration for
other objects like compute nodes, services and migrations.

Change-Id: I5de0979e280004c1ce0acc99d69cc96089a704f8
Closes-Bug: #1735188
(cherry picked from commit e727437b0ccdcc15e8ccd9b7a7c232a878dadd2d)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ValueError when loading old pci device record

Old pci_devices records might not have a uuid value set
and when we load those out of the database, the
PciDevice._from_db_object code was blindly trying to set
the PciDevice.uuid field to None, which fails because the
PciDevice.uuid field is not nullable.

This change fixes the problem by skipping the 'uuid' field
if it's not set in the db record so that we can auto-generate
a uuid later and update the object with it, which also performs
our online data migration.

This is similar to how we handle the uuid online migration for
other objects like compute nodes, services and migrations.

Change-Id: I5de0979e280004c1ce0acc99d69cc96089a704f8
Closes-Bug: #1735188
(cherry picked from commit e727437b0ccdcc15e8ccd9b7a7c232a878dadd2d)

and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I81d832dfde5178ebc0f7a6faafe7427854cbaed4

commit_message:
Use global variable to define dbdriver instance

Use global variable to define dbdriver instance to avoid import
etcd_api and create etcd client every times api call

Change-Id: Ie1e2a1cca0dceee1bb2502e894dba1c32f023ea0

commit_message:
Ensure the role works when run in serial

The role tests execute in parallel however the integrated repo executes
in serial. This change simply makes sure that this role always functions
no matter the execution method.

Change-Id: I3938eb54996a8ea5183cf4109b992451345b0585
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add cluster support in migration and manage

This patch adds support for API microversion 3.16, which allows us to
pass --cluster optional argument to migration and manage operations.

For this, a new type of CLI argument is added, the mutually exclusive
arguments that can be used similarly to the utils.arg decorator, but
with utils.exclusive_arg decorator.

Implements: blueprint cinder-volume-active-active-support
Change-Id: If004715b9887d2a0f9fc630b44d6e11a4a8b778d

[{'created': '2017-11-28 16:03:53.000000000', 'message': 'fullstack: Wait at least 3 minute for agents to report

Test runner polls neutron-server for agents for default value of
wait_until_true() which is 60 seconds. It has been proven to be
insufficient time on busy environments. This patch bumps the timeout to
3 minutes and also highers polling interval from 1 seconds to 10
seconds, to offload neutron-server.

Change-Id: I108176ee5668c2bc456dda1810aa509212e7cb38
Closes-bug: #1734357
(cherry picked from commit 89e0ed9e3d1630197545280ef6c11828d0f2b1dc)
'}]
commit_message:
fullstack: Wait at least 3 minute for agents to report

Test runner polls neutron-server for agents for default value of
wait_until_true() which is 60 seconds. It has been proven to be
insufficient time on busy environments. This patch bumps the timeout to
3 minutes and also highers polling interval from 1 seconds to 10
seconds, to offload neutron-server.

Change-Id: I108176ee5668c2bc456dda1810aa509212e7cb38
Closes-bug: #1734357
(cherry picked from commit 89e0ed9e3d1630197545280ef6c11828d0f2b1dc)

commit_message:
Implement policy in code - docs and reno (end)

This commit adds docs and reno for migrating policies
into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I67984292022e2a92306b268a40861cff625c22c9

commit_message:
Implement policy in code - event trigger (11)

This commit migrate all event trigger policies into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

This commit also remove policy.json file usage completely.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Icd674fdc248e5b9c63f9e7d0f47c53288291ff07

commit_message:
Implement policy in code - workflow (10)

This commit migrate all workflow policies into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I8ab332abb5ebd4c67f8baf62c43ac3e9a10d7ee1

commit_message:
Implement policy in code - member (7)

This commit migrate all member policies into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I166d0d62489fa8230a2ba34ef09f9366ac321633

commit_message:
Implement policy in code - execution (6)

This commit migrate all execution policies into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>
Closes-Bug: #1723333
Change-Id: I3e1d9f5b61d9f2511190fb810726aeb22912ad7b

commit_message:
Implement policy in code - environment (5)

This commit migrate all environment policies into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I97307ad7f4c01d9b78ddf1b4cda8e59e736a7831

commit_message:
Implement policy in code - cron trigger (4)

This commit migrate all cron trigger policies into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Ib877e4ac6ebfe4068e85705955923d162757689f

commit_message:
Implement policy in code - action execution (2)

This commit migrate all action execution policies into code [1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Dai Dang-Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: Ic4b597995ae2ab49e793871c14060f0b9662f468

subject: use l3 api def from neutron-lib
messages: [{'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2017-11-28 13:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14605, 'date': '2017-12-01 02:24:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-12-01 14:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 13:33:49.000000000', 'message': 'use l3 api def from neutron-lib

Commit I81748aa0e48b1275df3e1ea41b1d36a117d0097d added the l3 extension
API definition to neutron-lib, commit
I2324a3a02789c798248cab41c278a2d9981d24be rehomed the l3 exceptions and
Ifd79eb1a92853e49bd4ef028e7a7bd89811c6957 shims the l3 exceptions in
neutron.

This patch consumes the l3 API definition from neutron-lib
in prep for If2e66e06b83e15ee2851ea2bc3b64ad366e675dd

Change-Id: Ie5f87829ce55fed290bce4be933b9e2b0615be46
'}]
commit_message:
use l3 api def from neutron-lib

Commit I81748aa0e48b1275df3e1ea41b1d36a117d0097d added the l3 extension
API definition to neutron-lib, commit
I2324a3a02789c798248cab41c278a2d9981d24be rehomed the l3 exceptions and
Ifd79eb1a92853e49bd4ef028e7a7bd89811c6957 shims the l3 exceptions in
neutron.

This patch consumes the l3 API definition from neutron-lib
in prep for If2e66e06b83e15ee2851ea2bc3b64ad366e675dd

Change-Id: Ie5f87829ce55fed290bce4be933b9e2b0615be46

commit_message:
move doc requirements to doc/requirements.txt

The documentation jobs now look for requirements in
doc/requirements.txt and do not use tox for release notes. Move the
dependency list from setup.cfg to the new file and update tox.ini so
the developer experience is consistent with what the CI system does.

Change-Id: I739c9eba21d1b9a680d6b0e9cc6a4cbaca56e543
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add ovb-basic pingtest

A pingtest without boot from volume testing (already tested by scenarios
with Tempest).
This pingtest will be used until we switch all OVB jobs to Tempest.
Also deploy Heat since pingtest use orchestration API.

Change-Id: I2881995d7156fb80eeffa81078e8f32f2668a6d5

names to the correct keys when using a self signed certificate.

commit_message:
Fix the key lookup names for self-signed SSL

The key lookup names were broken when using SSL. This sets the lookup
names to the correct keys when using a self signed certificate and moves
the self-signed tasks into their own task file.

Change-Id: I5f6465f0d955cc1b911a4a76482505edb16c69a8
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Implement policy in code (1)

This commit prepare for implementing policies in code[1].

Like oslo.config, with oslo.policy, we can define all of
default rules in code base and only change some rules
via policy file. Another thing that we should use yaml
format instead of json format.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/policy-in-code.html
Co-authored-By: Hieu LE <hieulq@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I2051b6c25333c95aa9ea6786964d4ab710ea93e8

commit_message:
Updates capabilities map to use ceph-ansible

All references to puppet-ceph in the capabilities map are replaced
with their equivalend for ceph-ansible.

Change-Id: Ibc70bf2161f7c106dbb86cf037ebfb5eef20bb2f

commit_message:
Add scaffolding for contrib tasks

This patch adds the basic scaffolding for developer-contributed
hardening standards that are outside the scope of the Security
Technical Implementation Guide (STIG). Deployers have the option
to deploy these hardening standards as well.

Change-Id: I33175ffd36a75d27e5ac6c13aaf1584e5fdf23dd

commit_message:
Improve gate post jobs

- Reuse build jobs to publish images
- Add binary jobs in periodic pipeline
- Push all image to dockerhub
- Use branch name for image tag

Change-Id: Ifefb96bcbcc9c6840cf865f7786b43a43fae4c17
(cherry picked from commit 9846a27a6b453d4591979653d7ac0d52f7930fc7)

commit_message:
Insert a new virtual service to log br-int flows

It will log the br-int flows periodically every 30 seconds, to
help us debugging issues related to arp reponder not working.

Change-Id: I270942d69c64289bf3f861b12617673ff28a9e56

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

Follow https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh, we can build without it.

Create new doc/requirements.txt file with doc requirements to make them
optional. We cannot use ".[test]" with pip, it would still install
project with constraints and fail.

Change-Id: I4f1fa1fd3139a763222b0a0f18394a7660c62497

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

tools/tox_install.sh.

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I3dc0cbfa99564e7f45e8ef7b1687464e8d78c600

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: Iafae5f3111c968a4ec2adf63e447459f3ccc41ae

Fix JSON generation when scenario has hooks

Patch the code according to hooks' internal structure. Generate
JSON report in `self` verification job.

Closes-Bug: #1734336

commit_message:
inject file: add description of injecting multiple files.

We support inject multiple files by one cmd.
This patch adds some description and limitation
in help messages.

Change-Id: I481d2c83530c82e18661a13d53580501e721754f
Signed-off-by: Chen Hanxiao <chenhx@certusnet.com.cn>

commit_message:
Fix optional services-docker environment files

Fix relative paths to templates.
Add missing Redis for Gnocchi, otherwise it fails to DB-sync as nothing
listens 6379 port.

Change-Id: I6194696b187bca7a2261ee8338b81a2867544c11
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Deal with partitions without NAME labels

Partition NAME labels are optional; update parser to deal with
an empty name.

Closes-Bug: 1731639

commit_message:
Drop default URI, make either a session or inspector_url required

While convenient sometimes, the previous default behavior of assuming
127.0.0.1 is too unrealistic for production and may cause confusion.

Change-Id: I32496bc57f0127e680bbd1823401ab0211f93114

commit_message:
Add featureset33 for scenario009

featureset033 will deploy a multinode job and instead of OpenStack on the
overcloud, we'll deploy COE (OpenShift) with scenario009. The job is
experimental for now.

Change-Id: I9786f1a27cb7c765211dffe0ea06afd75f8e5275

commit_message:
Stop translation job for django-openstack-auth master branch

In Queens cycle, django-openstack-auth has been merged into
the horizon master branch. We no longer need the translation jobs
for the master branch of django-openstack-auth.

Note that we still maintains the stable branches so
upstream-translation-update job needs to be enabled
for the stable branches.

Change-Id: I4f700c6edc2155fb57a043ea5322f6e3c24d925a

commit_message:
Drop legacy-horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin

The legacy job has been converted into
horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin in openstack/horizon repo
(https://review.openstack.org/#/c/519084/).

We can now drop the legacy horizon-dsvm-tempest-plugin
from horizon and tempest-horizon gates.

Needed-By: Id9371caea84b964505e7ba1e18ecbedc1d9ad825
Change-Id: I8ac2f9098b698c14de131c25b77e1110a84a770d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 23:07:24.000000000', 'message': "Tolerate ports in tag discover

The tag parsing assumed there would only be one colon in the path,
which does not hold when there is a port in the registry path.

Once again we're bitten by image names not being real URLs.

Change-Id: Ia2d0efeaa269d61f6669b141d745ab2c1bb306da
Closes-Bug: #1735565
"}]
commit_message:
Tolerate ports in tag discover

The tag parsing assumed there would only be one colon in the path,
which does not hold when there is a port in the registry path.

Once again we're bitten by image names not being real URLs.

Change-Id: Ia2d0efeaa269d61f6669b141d745ab2c1bb306da
Closes-Bug: #1735565

commit_message:
Remove old-style quotas code

In Pike, we re-architected quotas to count resources for quota usage
instead of tracking it separately and stopped using reservations.
During an upgrade to Queens, old computes (Pike) will be using
new-style quotas and so the old-style quotas code is no longer needed.

Change-Id: Ie01ab1c3a1219f1d123f0ecedc66a00dfb2eb2c1

commit_message:
Switch to tripleomaster registry by default

The tripleoupstream registry is deprecated in favor of tripleomaster,
where images are pushed automatically on rdo promotion.

Change-Id: I84724efedb6e7ff967469d0e4277aa6fd9538748

[{'created': '2017-11-30 17:41:27.000000000', 'message': 'Skip releasenotes on driverfixes branches

commit_message:
Skip releasenotes on driverfixes branches

We do not want or need release notes to be processed on the
driverfixes branches. This adds an exclusion for that job
for all driverfixes/* branches.

Change-Id: I932293d01f1616557660a62276fd5c91161e088d

commit_message:
Remove unused tox_install.sh

This repo does not use tox_install.sh, remove it.

We're in the process of replacing it everywhere, removing an unused file
is an easy win.

commit_message:
Run dstat in gate tests

This will enable dstat dumps at 3 second intervals in the background
during gate jobs. In the gate job exit tasks, dstat_graph[1] will be
used to generate an HTML compilation of the dstat data.

[1] https://github.com/Dabz/dstat_graph

Change-Id: I8475098a75528f8260a41f853a243b08296e3855
(cherry picked from commit af28cf025ba0ccbad8bca215de767fb97d0cc1c3)
(cherry picked from commit 7a40b17bf6c3ed6013480680549a933bdd9a85cc)

commit_message:
Add masakari-dashboard project

This project is to add horizon plugin for masakari.

NOTE:
This patch is also adding channel log bot for below masakari-* projects:
- openstack/masakari
  - openstack/masakari-dashboard
  - openstack/masakari-monitors
  - openstack/masakari-specs
  - openstack/python-masakariclient

Needed-By:I39e2c62c0c4c1ca87855824c367e8d9f84224848
Change-Id: Ia86bd9522e0f8e8d00324757e03956407c595ba5

commit_message:
Make api jobs post playbooks honor zuul_work_dir

We tried to add os-api-ref-nova-src to run api-ref build on nova content
on changes to api-ref, but this hardcodes project. Make it honor
zuul_work_dir. Also do api-guide while we're here, since it's the same
pattern.

Change-Id: I97448d681e3e48753496818fa248ee96dd36d65b

subject: IP should be optional in lsp_set_addresses
messages: [{'account_id': 27378, 'date': '2017-11-30 18:07:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2017-11-30 20:07:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2017-12-01 09:39:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 18:07:04.000000000', 'message': 'IP should be optional in lsp_set_addresses

ovsdbapp, unlike ovn-nbctl, does not allow address in lsp_set_addresses
to be a MAC alone without an IP.

ovn-nbctl.8 manual:
"an  Ethernet  address, optionally followed by a space and one or
more IP addresses"

With this patch, IP address is optional.

Change-Id: I6a3708b22b7f9c11af1960bfa6be7413e497534c
'}]
commit_message:
IP should be optional in lsp_set_addresses

ovsdbapp, unlike ovn-nbctl, does not allow address in lsp_set_addresses
to be a MAC alone without an IP.

ovn-nbctl.8 manual:
"an  Ethernet  address, optionally followed by a space and one or
more IP addresses"

With this patch, IP address is optional.

Change-Id: I6a3708b22b7f9c11af1960bfa6be7413e497534c

commit_message:
Fix logging permissions for IPA

Since the change to Zuulv3 based CI, we've observed some
changes in default permissions which cause some CI jobs to
now fail.

As such, adding the creation of /var/log/ironic the setup of
ironic.

Change-Id: I8b6dbb724c6de618798d4207fbfacc935837ae57

The tunnel needs to be created from the lab host into the undercloud,
as indicated in the step before the example. However because the

commit_message:
Fix typo in tunnel example (UI deployments)

The tunnel needs to be created from the lab host into the undercloud,
as indicated in the step before the example. However because the
example used '@virthost' as a placeholder instead of '@undercloud', it
causes confusion and can lead users to make mistakes.

Change-Id: I19aa5583318d540fc490174ac3e2b15a8539e36f

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-22 13:26:49.000000000', 'message': 'Stop doing double mocking of all the things "execute"

Currently we configure mocks for execute() and similar and setUp, and then
we expect the unit tests to have other mocks on top of these mocks. This
does not work, at least not with autospec. The resulting 2nd-level mocks
end up being mocks of mocks, with assert_* methods mocked.

Change-Id: Ib242c3ca5be816aed0b5f67e0df721489ab33480
'}, {'created': '2017-11-22 13:29:08.000000000', 'message': 'Stop doing double mocking of all the things "execute"

Currently we configure mocks for execute() and similar and setUp, and then
we expect the unit tests to have other mocks on top of these mocks. This
does not work, at least not with autospec. The resulting 2nd-level mocks
end up being mocks of mocks, with assert_* methods mocked.

Instead, use fixtures and create mocks only once in setUp.

Change-Id: Ib242c3ca5be816aed0b5f67e0df721489ab33480
'}]
commit_message:
Stop doing double mocking of all the things "execute"

Currently we configure mocks for execute() and similar and setUp, and then
we expect the unit tests to have other mocks on top of these mocks. This
does not work, at least not with autospec. The resulting 2nd-level mocks
end up being mocks of mocks, with assert_* methods mocked.

Instead, use fixtures and create mocks only once in setUp.

Change-Id: Ib242c3ca5be816aed0b5f67e0df721489ab33480

commit_message:
Log the error from OrchestrationDeployAction

If the action fails, it returns an error to be used in the workflow.
While this is useful it means there is little trace of the error in the
log files. Adding the error also to the logs will make it easier to
debug and track down.

Related-Bug: #1734747
Change-Id: I5faba1feec7e87bb595edb3448a096caa0812a9b

We have raised this question some time ago and came to conclusion that there could be some different sources of loads on compute node. It may include guest load (hypervisor), system load, user load and so on. We may be sure that compute node works only with vms in test lab, but there may be differences in production.'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2017-07-14 03:44:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I doubt the result of the optimization, if mix guest and other load together as the node load, because they are not always corresponding. In my view, just consider an single factor(use the guest load as the node load), it may perform better. In addition, it migrates guest load to achieve balance, so it should use guest load as the measurement index.'}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2017-07-17 08:42:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

We have tested this strategy and it shows the results we've been waiting for. I would suggest you to provide the ability to choose way to gather loads as we always do the same in such situations."}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2017-07-19 14:40:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

For future purposes, such as workload visualization, if unify method to calculate the compute node load, dashboard or watcher-dashboard could simply use the very same method to calculate the compute node load for display.
If we don't unify the method, it will gives two diffrent workload values, and that would make user confused."}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2017-12-01 09:12:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Get load of every available host by gathering instances load

We calculate migration case, based on current hosts and instance
load. The hosts and instances load should be coincident.
Because 'cpu_util' and 'compute.node.cpu.percent', 'memory.resident'
and 'hardware.memory.used' have no direct correlation.
So change the method to calculate the hosts workload.
The hypervisor workload of each node should be calculated by
summing up workload of all VMs on each node.
refer to:
https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/watcher-specs/specs/newton/implemented/sd-strategy.html

Change-Id: I3e378bb7e1850561089dd3c3176e8f6cb88032a2

commit_message:
Make gnocchi as default datasource

This patch set follows deprecation steps
and changes default datasource to gnocchi

Closes-Bug: #1735180
Change-Id: I3b7ec47af7707359373a424a6469d28cbf9ce177

commit_message:
Add openstack/governance-sigs repo under Meta SIG

Create a repository to hold content for the future
governance.o.o/sigs website. Since this is the first
repository owned by a SIG, create a reference document
to track SIG-owned repositories.

Depends-On: I6688a77fe6f68cb3847ddf0d5e18568dccaa73c5
Change-Id: Ic626a9ae1d04cac1bf448c8acefc06fe84d6f46a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4162, 'name': 'Paul Belanger', 'email': 'pabelanger@redhat.com', 'username': 'pabelanger'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23840, 'name': 'Hiroaki Kobayashi', 'email': 'kobayashi.hiroaki@lab.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'hiro-kobayashi'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-23 12:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-23 13:05:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-11-24 00:29:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Question to othe reviewers, do we have any tooling to help validate this? I admit, I do not know how tag validations work.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-24 09:10:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Question to othe reviewers, do we have any tooling to help validate this? I admit, I do not know how tag validations work.

It looks like there is a 'validate' environment in tox.ini.

And actually - it failed:

* I18n should not have the tag 'team:diverse-affiliation'

Thierry, any reason that team wasn't updated in this change?"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-24 10:44:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Yes, I18n doesn't have enough commits / reviews for that change to be significant. Most of the translations work happens in Zanata and has very diverse affiliation, so I left out that change.

Raw data can be obtained using "tox -e venv -- python3 tools/teamstats.py" in case you want to validate the others. A quick look at Stackalytics is also usually enough to check.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2017-11-24 10:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

Maybe we should add an exception in the validation so that the job can be green?'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-24 12:51:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As time passes after the tag update, this job starts to fail again pretty fast (as soon as the metrics change and no longer match the tags), so I'm not sure there is that much value in having it fully green at this particular point in time..."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-24 12:52:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Maybe we should move it to the experimental / on-demand pipeline, since it's only useful to validate the diversity patch every 2-3 months..."}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2017-11-27 01:27:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-11-27 13:45:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-27 18:55:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-29 17:49:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-11-30 05:13:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

Thanks for the info.'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-11-30 16:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

+1 on moving to the experimental pipeline'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-12-01 08:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-23 12:31:20.000000000', 'message': 'Update team corporate diversity tags

* Blazar is no longer single-vendor, due to increased participation
  from independent contributors
* Cyborg has diverse affiliation (Huawei, Lenovo, Red Hat...)
* Designate now has diverse affiliation, thanks to increased
  participation from x-ion, Verizon, 99cloud, SUSE...
* Dragonflow is now single-vendor, with all Core reviewers working
  for Huawei
* Karbor is no longer single-vendor, due to increased participation
  from China Mobile
* Kuryr no longer has diverse affiliation, with more than half the
  code reviews coming from Red Hat.
* Masakari is not single-vendor, it has significant participation
  from NTT, NEC, and independent contributors
* OpenStack-Helm is single-vendor, with most core reviews coming
  from AT&T
* Rally no longer has diverse affiliation, with most activity coming
  from GoDaddy
* Shade now has diverse-affiliation, with increased involvement of
  SUSE, Rackspace, and OVH
* Tricircle is now single-vendor, with most core reviews coming from
  Huawei
* Trove is currently single-vendor, with all core reviewers coming
  from IBM

Change-Id: I572652f868fa2cb60e1730220b0e82f37799e306
'}]
commit_message:
Update team corporate diversity tags

* Blazar is no longer single-vendor, due to increased participation
  from independent contributors
* Cyborg has diverse affiliation (Huawei, Lenovo, Red Hat...)
* Designate now has diverse affiliation, thanks to increased
  participation from x-ion, Verizon, 99cloud, SUSE...
* Dragonflow is now single-vendor, with all Core reviewers working
  for Huawei
* Karbor is no longer single-vendor, due to increased participation
  from China Mobile
* Kuryr no longer has diverse affiliation, with more than half the
  code reviews coming from Red Hat.
* Masakari is not single-vendor, it has significant participation
  from NTT, NEC, and independent contributors
* OpenStack-Helm is single-vendor, with most core reviews coming
  from AT&T
* Rally no longer has diverse affiliation, with most activity coming
  from GoDaddy
* Shade now has diverse-affiliation, with increased involvement of
  SUSE, Rackspace, and OVH
* Tricircle is now single-vendor, with most core reviews coming from
  Huawei
* Trove is currently single-vendor, with all core reviewers coming
  from IBM

Change-Id: I572652f868fa2cb60e1730220b0e82f37799e306

As is, the code messes up during upgrades.
There's a query asking for 'osapi_compute' and host, returns 0
Then it tries to insert with 'nova-osapi_compute', which fails as it already
has an entry.

This could really just be reduced to an
UPDATE
if fail INSERT

"}, {'created': '2017-09-06 18:39:28.000000000', 'message': "Fix binary name.

"}, {'created': '2017-09-11 07:35:15.000000000', 'message': "Fix binary name

Before an upgrade, we have these type of entries in the db.

MariaDB [nova]> SELECT id, host, `binary`, deleted, version FROM services;
+----+--------------+--------------------+---------+---------+
| id | host         | binary             | deleted | version |
+----+--------------+--------------------+---------+---------+
|  5 | r1-n-os-api  | nova-osapi_compute | 0       |      16 |
| 21 | r1-n-m-api   | nova-metadata      | 0       |      16 |

The wsgi files we run basically boil down to something like

  NAME=metadata
  return wsgi_app.init_application(NAME)

In the wsgi_app.py we see this function

  service_ref = objects.Service.get_by_host_and_binary(ctxt, host, name)

Which results in a really big query, which again comes down to

  SELECT host, `binary` FROM services
    WHERE host = 'r1-n-m-api' AND `binary` == 'metadata'

No results. service_ref is set to None. Carry on.

  if service_ref:
    #Nope.
  else:
    try:
      ...
      service_obj.host = host
      service_obj.binary = 'nova-%s' % name
      service_obj.create()

Which results in a INSERT statement something like this;

  INSERT INTO services(host, `binary`, report_count, disabled, deleted, version)
    VALUES ('r1-n-m-api', 'nova-metadata', 0, 0, 0, 22)

  ERROR 1062 (23000): Duplicate entry 'r1-n-m-api-nova-metadata-0' for key 'uniq_services0host0binary0deleted'

So the first suggested fix is to prepend 'nova-' to the name, and make both
queries ask for 'nova-metadata'.  There's also a check that it doesn't start
with 'nova-', incase someone decides to prepend 'nova-' to the NAME= in the
wsgi-file. Which migth be a litte overkill, but just a safeguard none the less.

Change-Id: I58cf9a0115a98c78e5d2fb57c41c13ba6fac0fad
Closes-bug: 1715463
"}]
commit_message:
Fix binary name

Before an upgrade, we have these type of entries in the db.

MariaDB [nova]> SELECT id, host, `binary`, deleted, version FROM services;
+----+--------------+--------------------+---------+---------+
| id | host         | binary             | deleted | version |
+----+--------------+--------------------+---------+---------+
|  5 | r1-n-os-api  | nova-osapi_compute | 0       |      16 |
| 21 | r1-n-m-api   | nova-metadata      | 0       |      16 |

The wsgi files we run basically boil down to something like

  NAME=metadata
  return wsgi_app.init_application(NAME)

In the wsgi_app.py we see this function

  service_ref = objects.Service.get_by_host_and_binary(ctxt, host, name)

Which results in a really big query, which again comes down to

  SELECT host, `binary` FROM services
    WHERE host = 'r1-n-m-api' AND `binary` == 'metadata'

No results. service_ref is set to None. Carry on.

  if service_ref:
    #Nope.
  else:
    try:
      ...
      service_obj.host = host
      service_obj.binary = 'nova-%s' % name
      service_obj.create()

Which results in a INSERT statement something like this;

  INSERT INTO services(host, `binary`, report_count, disabled, deleted, version)
    VALUES ('r1-n-m-api', 'nova-metadata', 0, 0, 0, 22)

  ERROR 1062 (23000): Duplicate entry 'r1-n-m-api-nova-metadata-0' for key 'uniq_services0host0binary0deleted'

So the first suggested fix is to prepend 'nova-' to the name, and make both
queries ask for 'nova-metadata'.  There's also a check that it doesn't start
with 'nova-', incase someone decides to prepend 'nova-' to the NAME= in the
wsgi-file. Which migth be a litte overkill, but just a safeguard none the less.

Change-Id: I58cf9a0115a98c78e5d2fb57c41c13ba6fac0fad
Closes-bug: 1715463

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 10:07:25.000000000', 'message': 'Stable policy applies to main OpenStack components

The stable:follows-policy tag is meant to provide information
about components of an OpenStack cloud, but does not apply so
well to downstream packaging or lifecycle management tools,
where the expectations are different[1].

This proposal recenters the tag on those "cloud software"
components, and removes the expectation that lifecycle management
tools or SDKs are expected to get that tag to show maturity.

If this is approved, the "Software Navigator" on openstack.org
will be updated so that missing that tag no longer adversely
affects the maturity score of deployment tools.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123624.html

Change-Id: I1c1ad6b4843a04b7b5debb092fa49bffad4b12ac
'}]
commit_message:
Stable policy applies to main OpenStack components

The stable:follows-policy tag is meant to provide information
about components of an OpenStack cloud, but does not apply so
well to downstream packaging or lifecycle management tools,
where the expectations are different[1].

This proposal recenters the tag on those "cloud software"
components, and removes the expectation that lifecycle management
tools or SDKs are expected to get that tag to show maturity.

If this is approved, the "Software Navigator" on openstack.org
will be updated so that missing that tag no longer adversely
affects the maturity score of deployment tools.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123624.html

Change-Id: I1c1ad6b4843a04b7b5debb092fa49bffad4b12ac

messages:
[{'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2017-11-20 16:56:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2017-11-20 16:58:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-20 17:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Woot!

I don't remember if we laid out any detailed process for applying this tag to new projects. Having an advisory policy in the interop group seems like a reasonable first step, as long as it doesn't progress past advisory until we have the tag in place signifying the TC approval.

I think we need the feature set for designate. I'd love to see it added to the compute policy. Starting with a separate policy seems like a good first step.

That said, we do still have designate on our "top 5" list where we ask for contributors to help maintain it. What's the status of the project today? Is it being maintained with sufficient input to be a good candidate for a long term trademark policy?'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2017-11-20 18:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@doug:

Yeah, there is no current process [1], but I figured we were in a good place to add it, and figure out the process as we went.

I think we are in a much better place, especially for maintaining the core InterOp tested features. 

More distros are adding support for designate, and the number of deployments has increased year on year, all of which should help drive it for the long term.

Help is still wanted, but we are not in same situation as we were in Pike where it was mainly a volunteer lead release.

1 - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/tc_approved-release.html#requirements'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-20 19:46:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

 > Yeah, there is no current process [1], but I figured we were in a

Yep.

 > the core InterOp tested features.
 > 
 > More distros are adding support for designate, and the number of
 > deployments has increased year on year, all of which should help
 > drive it for the long term.
 > 
 > Help is still wanted, but we are not in same situation as we were
 > in Pike where it was mainly a volunteer lead release.
 > 
 > 1 - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/tags/tc_approved-release.html#requirements

It's good to hear that the team feels stable enough to go forward with the trademark program."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2017-11-21 13:42:55.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from tc-approved-release to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-21 14:34:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-11-22 10:21:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2017-11-22 15:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

commit_message:
Add designate to the tc:approved-release tag

With the addition of the add-on programs to the foundation
trademark policy designate is now being used as part of a
trademark program. [1]

We should include Designate as part of the list of projects
proposed by the TC for these programs.

1 - Ib23c44fa9385727162e873fe42c719faa323a481

Change-Id: I63f94fd601c989b3fa9b3d1ec739d08bb5b060da

commit_message:
Update PyPy version

This is the time of the cycle where we update all the static
elements in the roles. PyPy has a static file version, so we
bump it.

Change-Id: I15c21c177c32dcae0a7f2710b50f91829be09586

commit_message:
Exclude 'vnet' interfaces from being candidates for running a dhcp client.

Vnet interfaces are not supported by the dhcp client.

Bug #1731871

Change-Id: I8c0d6b0885f7e5fac94f78c8d6b6a6bf198ff424
Signed-off-by: Wojciech Dec <wdec@cisco.com>

commit_message:
Add mock to avoid writing missing files to disk

The 'fake' file was being created and left on disk when running the
unit tests, sometimes causing random failures during directory
creation. This mocks the function in all tests to avoid this, and adds
a new unit test specific to it to ensure we don't lose coverage.

Change-Id: I6cf6ec5e85af4a748e00383f7ee65636eb5a3251
Closes-Bug: #1732010

[{'created': '2017-10-12 20:35:53.000000000', 'message': 'Conditionally include nova patch config in Nuage

For configuring SRIOV, Nuage code relies on setting monkey patch parameters.
These parameters are available from nova::patch::config class. This change
includes the config class if SRIOV is present as one of the mechanism_drivers.
The change depends on the addition of nova patching configuration parameters.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500107

Depends-On: I51ef3e19daff1d98cfe5c2c16475c16e6a3e3e0f

commit_message:
Conditionally include nova patch config in Nuage

For configuring SRIOV, Nuage code relies on setting monkey patch parameters.
These parameters are available from nova::patch::config class. This change
includes the config class if SRIOV is present as one of the mechanism_drivers.
The change depends on the addition of nova patching configuration parameters.
This approach will not fly for Queens and later due to containerized
deployments, but as of Pike, there is no clean approach of separating out
neutron and nova completely. This review is meant for Pike and earlier
releases only. More info can be found here:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/500107

Depends-On: I51ef3e19daff1d98cfe5c2c16475c16e6a3e3e0f
Change-Id: Ic2e912cba51a7dd585e896b785056a281104fd74

commit_message:
Fix undercloud inventory ansible_host

Making ansible_host=undercloud won't work for some modules such as the
'synchronize' rsync module because there is no real hosts entry. This
change fixes this by setting ansible_host={{ undercloud_ip }} instead.

Change-Id: I4e0823dffd9da9186836e0959d9c28112f747198

commit_message:
Silence repo-setup task

This task dumps a lot of text to the ansible run, and it is saved to a
log file anyway.

Change-Id: I48344f40ad698abb499ad453e1c0216376504d28

* do we need this code in Pike to make upgrade working?
* do we want this code in Pike to make upgrades better?
* have we evaluated the risk of breaking current workflow versus merging this patch during a feature freeze and so close from a stable release?

commit_message:
Add the major upgrade converge in the update workbook

The update workbook aim to be the main entry point
for major and minor update.
The converge step is still needed for the major upgrade
so we need to add it in the workbook.

In a follow up patch, im planning to rename the
'package_update' to 'update' or 'upgrade'.

Change-Id: I70193dccd6e70f53a2d09d6de5f66a5b8a40f144

[{'created': '2017-09-04 09:46:34.000000000', 'message': 'Disable pipelining mode in Ansible config

When running ansible playbook in pipelining mode
the deployment fails with: "sudo: sorry, you must have a tty to run sudo\n",

This disables the pipelining mode by default.

There is another workaround by removing the
requiretty in /etc/sudoers

Change-Id: Id9e0e0b756afdc2daa4e05437855ecfbfcbb9f7e
Closes-Bug: 1714917
'}]
commit_message:
Disable pipelining mode in Ansible config

When running ansible playbook in pipelining mode
the deployment fails with: "sudo: sorry, you must have a tty to run sudo\n",

This disables the pipelining mode by default.

There is another workaround by removing the
requiretty in /etc/sudoers

Change-Id: Id9e0e0b756afdc2daa4e05437855ecfbfcbb9f7e
Closes-Bug: 1714917

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-20 15:12:30.000000000', 'message': 'Make provision/remote role safe to include statically

Currently including the provision/remote role without intending to
actually use it will break if the {{ virt_host_key }}.pub file does
not exist.

Ideally, we would be able to include it dynamically so that the
tasks are not evaluated at compile time, but instead only if they
are run. This would require a pretty large refactor though, because
playbooks can not be included dynamically.

Instead, we can make sure to have a default for the lookup so that
it will not fail to evaluate. The task would still fail to run if
the lookup falls back to the default, so we wont hide issues with
the key not existing with this change.

Change-Id: I347de079ada7c7b82f2f7affafa97f95c8029a3f

commit_message:
Make provision/remote role safe to include statically

Currently including the provision/remote role without intending to
actually use it will break if the {{ virt_host_key }}.pub file does
not exist.

Ideally, we would be able to include it dynamically so that the
tasks are not evaluated at compile time, but instead only if they
are run. This would require a pretty large refactor though, because
playbooks can not be included dynamically.

Instead, we can make sure to have a default for the lookup so that
it will not fail to evaluate. The task would still fail to run if
the lookup falls back to the default, so we wont hide issues with
the key not existing with this change.

Change-Id: I347de079ada7c7b82f2f7affafa97f95c8029a3f

commit_message:
Don't hardcode .quickstart since this is configurable

When running oooq with the -w option, the ~/.quickstart directory
will no longer exist, it will be a different location.
Therefore the files we put there need to refer to that location,
not hardcoded to <homedir>/.quickstart.

Change-Id: Iea4eb23acc97b795e36a1f90e64ea4fdba4f70ce

Huh, so does this mean that external traffic has to get routed to some other node to get to the outside world?  I'll take your word for it that it's broken as-is, but I have to admit it's a little counterintuitive to me that the networking nodes aren't on the external network."}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2017-09-29 18:58:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ben, the networker nodes only need to be attached to the external network(s) via a bridge. Neutron can then create routers on whatever external VLANs are needed. The networker node doesn't host any public APIs, so there isn't any reason for the underlying host to have an IP on any external network."}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-09-29 20:44:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ah, got it.  So they do need a connection to the outside world, but Neutron handles all the configuration so we don't need to.  Thanks for the explanation."}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2017-10-01 12:16:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the clarification on the access to external bridge.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2017-11-15 02:39:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2017-11-15 21:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Remove External network from Networker role NIC configs

This change removes the External network from the Networker
role, since it is not used or needed on that role.

The External network appers in the NIC config templates for the
Networker role, but this network is not used by the Networker
role. This results in deployment errors, since no IP address
is created for the External network, and the Networker roles
cannot reach an external gateway.

Change-Id: I78e0c9b50a7fee8efeea1ab639b44e0c6f2aa922
Closes-bug: 1720257

commit_message:
Add extra quotes to ceilometer host fqdn

Evidently these are required in newton and promotions are failing

This change was introduced in  I92f6d351931f1ea598d6a382704e8f986129be42

Change-Id: I58b28df5f8f432e7e83c33860cac28eb7238b19f

commit_message:
gnocchi: mount the correct volume for /etc/ceph

During step4, /etc/ceph is the one of the host server instead
of the one generated by kolla.

This change uses the one generated by kolla and expose it to the
container.

Closes-bug: #1734134
Change-Id: Ia1cca1c5d228ce0a3ef23a7c92f96a20ab958437

commit_message:
undercloud: support the standard set of hardware types and interface

This change makes the THT-based undercloud use the same set of hardware
types and hardware interfaces as the instack-based by default.

IronicEnabled***Interfaces options are exposed for all interfaces,
except for work-in-progress rescue interface.

Change-Id: I97ce4eec9c8765480a5fd2e51ebd25e438f52754
Partial-Bug: #1690185

commit_message:
Remove use of deprecated optparse module

The optparse module has been deprecated for some time and all apps
should be updated to use argparse instead. This switches our one
remaining command that was using it to the newer argparse usage.

Change-Id: I8f801fb804515ecf2a8b402b2923135379730098
Closes-bug: #1553030

(1 comment)

-1 just for a couple of nits.

We're deleting the image upon failure of the task here (without the user ever knowing the image id?). That possibly makes it a little harder to debug what happened.

In the regular upload (PUT /v2/images/123/file) the image is not deleted, but is set back to 'queued'. I'm really not sure, but wonder if that is worth considering here? It wouldn't be possible to retry to that image id from the tasks interface, but the image id would be available to maybe help debug, and it may be possible to retry uploading the data via the standard upload API call."}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2016-03-15 14:19:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Changes behaviour when an image fails uploading

Currently when an image fails being uploaded the task is left in the
failed state (with the internal sever error message) and the image is
left in the saving state.

This patch calls for the image to be deleted as the image is never seen
by the user, also returns a more specific task error message.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I15fbe9f0041407892144c0d26eadc4ed939e5abf
Closes-Bug: 1487026

commit_message:
Properly validate metadef objects

Metadef objects were not being properly
validated when they had 1 or more properties.

This adds validation for any and all properties
attached to a metadef object being created.

Additionally, invalid metadef objects resulted in a
500 internal server error rather than a 400 bad request,
this fixes that so that the error is useful.

Change-Id: I6e6d97d54660710cf829a603b0741a23d248146b
Closes-Bug: #1413209
Co-Authored-By: Rebecca Finn <rebeccaX.finn@intel.com>

commit_message:
Fix broken diskimage-builder redirect

The diskimage-builder repo is listed in the governance repo as part of
the Infrastructure project, so
https://docs.openstack.org/diskimage-builder/ was redirecting to
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/diskimage-builder/ but the docs are
published at https://docs.openstack.org/diskimage-builder/latest/

It was doing the same to pypy. Add pypy to bindep with the pypy tag.
Cryptography and the version of pypi in xenial are incompatible, so

commit_message:
Fix py35 and pypy tox env

The basepython line was causing the py35 tests to actually run under
python2. Whoops.

It was doing the same to pypy. Add pypy to bindep with the pypy tag.
Cryptography and the version of pypi in xenial are incompatible, so
update the pypy job to run on fedora-26 instead, which has a new enough
pypy.

Shift the line so that it only applies to functional and ansible tests,
since that's where it's used.

Depends-On: I7c22e23b73ddfc18ee28e87d34d1988417b49ccb
Change-Id: Ia27a0aa0633dcf48c1bab06b3c803f996eae9efa

commit_message:
VMware: Handle concurrent registrations of the VC extension

During initialization, the Nova compute driver checks whether a
vCenter extension with key 'org.openstack.compute' exists and if
not, it registers one. This is a race condition. If multiple
services try to register the same extension, only one of them
will succeed. The fix is to catch InvalidArgument fault from
vSphere API and ignore the exception.

Change-Id: I92c24709a2f55b601c31a31b9e748f19e7e31984
Closes-Bug: #1704952

commit_message:
Add horizon domain dropdown

Added ``horizon_keystone_domain_choices`` hash. It can be used to set the
available domains to choose from on the horizon login page. This feature
was introduced in pike release.

Change-Id: Ia7d2bc45e518848a04ce78e7833e1cf9a0ef21ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-17 04:26:16.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: Ib67295cec33faedf095d56e1bc7301fe1ef97eb8
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html

Change-Id: Ib67295cec33faedf095d56e1bc7301fe1ef97eb8

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 06:14:27.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use -y for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: Ib64fd1f1774ff3f3e3fa5318e2fbe5d9f92d21fc
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use -y for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: Ib64fd1f1774ff3f3e3fa5318e2fbe5d9f92d21fc

commit_message:
Clean up Queens 'approved' directory

In Queens, we began putting lite specs each into their own file
instead of keeping them all in a single file.  This has left us with
"empty" Queens lite spec template files in the 'approved' directory,
so this patch removes them.

Change-Id: I5449c625653bb3aec7fdff30a831fb065ab9c084

commit_message:
Extract SortContext/SortWrapper of instance_list into utils

These will also be used by migration cross cell list.

So, This patch extract them into compute utils.py.

Change-Id: I885921ed1f5b1d95f4c14a51d00a9515ddb962d3

roles, but is required for migration of instancs. Adding the missing
services to the roles.

commit_message:
Added NovaMigrationTarget service to OVS-DPDK role

The service NovaMigrationTarget is missing in DPDK compute role,
but is required for migration of instances. Added the missing
service to the role.
Partial-Bug: #1730275

Change-Id: I1b51af450d6fcc36d57398e9ee3f2c3e73924e7f

commit_message:
zuul: run container jobs when touching puppet services

puppet services can break container jobs since they're still used by
docker services.

Change-Id: Ifdbede287b546a3b80086f56bc9bed95099ce433

commit_message:
Puppetfile: pin puppetlabs-haproxy to 1.5 (ocata commit)

... which is the latest tag and also the version we actually deploy in
TripleO.
Also remove puppet3 jobs, and keep only puppet4 (puppet3 support was
removed in ocata)

Change-Id: Ib7ea0eaf156121652ace7ee74a7b7003dd1376cd

commit_message:
Catch zaqar exception when no message to claim

On minor update, when the execution is still running
but there is no claim message anymore, we should
capture the zaqar exception to not print it to the
console

Change-Id: I802ffd553c54e4a4f9998420645aa078f508b9f0
Closes-Bug: #1734957
(cherry picked from commit c102747c8d8ec175831c2c35f83876c5e0d0c511)

commit_message:
Support more hardware types and deprecate enabled_drivers

Ironic is going to deprecate classic drivers in Queens and remove them in Rocky.
This change enables hardware types ilo and idrac that correspond to already
enabled classic drivers pxe_ilo and pxe_drac. It also adds support for other
common hardware types, but does not enable them by default.

The enabled_drivers option is deprecated.

Partial-Bug: #1690185
Change-Id: Ib505f3512627c49d17d6adcdc2622bdfe580a84f

commit_message:
Add entry per enabled service in the inventory

Expand the static inventory with an entry for each of the enabled
services. This allows to access the host/address for the services just
like it would be done in the overcloud.

An example of a scenario where this is needed is deploying services on a
kubernetes that has been deployed in the undercloud with tripleo. To
know where kubernetes is, we need to be able to get the hostname/address
for `kubernetes_master`

Change-Id: Ia32cef7da5187d3fe61bc168dd753e3b609e6938

commit_message:
Implements management of `/etc/login.defs`

Enables management of shadow password directives in login.defs

By allowing operators to set values in login.defs, they are able
to improve password security for newly created system accounts.

This change will in turn allow operators to adhere with security
hardening frameworks, such as STIG DISA & CIS Security Benchmarks.

bp login-defs

Change-Id: Id4fe88cb9569f18f27f94c35b5c27a85fe7947ae
Depends-On: Iec8c032adb44593da3770d3c6bb5a4655e463637

[{'created': '2017-11-24 16:16:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix ovs/netns mounts for neutron agents

Don't mount netns or /run from host system. If we mount /run or /run/netns then
it leads to broken netns on a host system level. Also when we remove containers
those netns bind files remain. This aslo causes problems.

Adapts I37c0783de6d6264ccf73648a1d15b23fdc31ad99 authored-by
Aleksandr Didenko <adidenko@mirantis.com>

Related-bug: #1734333

Change-Id: I462b40744610eb95031809d04b4ecce0d82a6e19
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ovs/netns mounts for neutron agents

Don't mount netns or /run from host system. If we mount /run or /run/netns then
it leads to broken netns on a host system level. Also when we remove containers
those netns bind files remain. This aslo causes problems.

Adapts I37c0783de6d6264ccf73648a1d15b23fdc31ad99 authored-by
Aleksandr Didenko <adidenko@mirantis.com>

Related-bug: #1734333

Change-Id: I462b40744610eb95031809d04b4ecce0d82a6e19
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-11-30 03:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-30 03:40:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-30 03:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nplease approve once it pass CI'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-30 06:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 03:31:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix neutron agent start order

In the baremetal deployment, we used to ensure that neutron-server was
started prior to starting up the various agents. In the containerized
deployment we need to ensure that we launch the agents after the server
has been started. We can do this by configuring a start_order for each
of the services.

It should be noted that the ovs agent was actually configured to start
in step5 on baremetal due to previous race conditions under HA
deployments. This change leaves it in step4 but configures the
start_order to be after the neutron-api service.

Change-Id: I3794400ef5c8ae620961914831ff85e3438b0399
Closes-Bug: #1734976
Related-Bug: #1663273
(cherry picked from commit c54c6222d8b517b8ee492caddaf47d2ef5780f31)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix neutron agent start order

In the baremetal deployment, we used to ensure that neutron-server was
started prior to starting up the various agents. In the containerized
deployment we need to ensure that we launch the agents after the server
has been started. We can do this by configuring a start_order for each
of the services.

It should be noted that the ovs agent was actually configured to start
in step5 on baremetal due to previous race conditions under HA
deployments. This change leaves it in step4 but configures the
start_order to be after the neutron-api service.

Change-Id: I3794400ef5c8ae620961914831ff85e3438b0399
Closes-Bug: #1734976
Related-Bug: #1663273
(cherry picked from commit c54c6222d8b517b8ee492caddaf47d2ef5780f31)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-05 15:47:10.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize model relationships (avoid joins, prefer subquery)

There are a large number of unnecessary joins which are currently
duplicating data and increasing the number of rows for simple
SQL queries.

It is not very easy to add the lazyloading again without a big
change in the architecture due to the dependence of these
components.  For those relationships that require to be there,
they will use `subquery` which will send much less data over
the line.  For the relationships that can be lazyloaded,
it was dropped.

Change-Id: Iddaaf7168611763a6fa76818e3be9d1aa24d8021
(cherry picked from commit e20d0bee721d93d8a2de7c22582e27af95c93386)
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize model relationships (avoid joins, prefer subquery)

There are a large number of unnecessary joins which are currently
duplicating data and increasing the number of rows for simple
SQL queries.

It is not very easy to add the lazyloading again without a big
change in the architecture due to the dependence of these
components.  For those relationships that require to be there,
they will use `subquery` which will send much less data over
the line.  For the relationships that can be lazyloaded,
it was dropped.

Change-Id: Iddaaf7168611763a6fa76818e3be9d1aa24d8021
(cherry picked from commit e20d0bee721d93d8a2de7c22582e27af95c93386)

commit_message:
ansible-role-requirements: Switch ODL git repo to the github mirror

Cloning from the official ODL git repository fails far too often with
the following error

fatal: unable to access 'https://git.opendaylight.org/gerrit/p/integration/packaging/ansible-opendaylight.git/': gnutls_handshake() failed: Error in the pull function

Lets switch to the github mirror which may be more reliable.

Change-Id: Ic8a1599b260ca3183e3cc78a9243f45f944899dc

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: Ib00b828c991d54fe3cbaea620e6623f378045fc5

subject: Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 19:03:27.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ia958f0a7436fbd116293b934562b64a340244177
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: Ia958f0a7436fbd116293b934562b64a340244177

[{'created': '2017-11-07 06:18:54.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use -y for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I49c9f0d63ba08656965c632644c45a0c92d874f9
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use -y for package install

According to "code conventions" [1], do not use "-y" option.
Instead, use apt-get install package, yum install package,
or zypper install package.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/writing-style/
code-conventions.html

Change-Id: I49c9f0d63ba08656965c632644c45a0c92d874f9

commit_message:
Fix datastore abnormal display with trove backup-show

According bug description, the datastore display abnormal
when use trove backup-show.  The cause of the problem
is method _print_object unformatted datastore from result.

Fix by formatted datastore where necessary.

Change-Id: Ifbcc8312e52eb3d052f5d24645d4d243ec50aed7
Closes-Bug: #1735157

commit_message:
doc: fix flavor notes

This fixes the two points in the note at the top of the
flavors page:

1. The policy rule in the first bullet was old so it's updated.

2. As of Ifa4e9cdfbbac1a1d4bf28679b24a17b13f637ddd in Pike,
   Horizon no longer allows you to 'edit' a flavor by default.
   Rather than try to explain historical bad behavior and the
   new default behavior in the Dashboard, the second bullet is
   simply removed.

Closes-Bug: #1715995

Change-Id: I372bf1e159d1db32461f843bd94c453d2e7df8d2
(cherry picked from commit a9f11002cc1b668b612a4ac7ce3d9662efbd2fd5)

commit_message:
Correctly configure the IPv6 LLA address

Handle a corner case where the address allocated by slaac is the
same as the ipv6 default link local address.

Closes-bug: #1709215
Change-Id: Ida667292fce41e281e016d56a278eef3b8939ed4

commit_message:
fix broken vmware-nsx periodic jobs

As per the recent logs from the vmware-nsx periodic jobs:
- The build-openstack-sphinx-docs job is failing due to missing project
dependencies. Note that we didn't explicitly enable this job in our
pipeline; it runs automatically. We will let this fail for now so no
changes in this patch (just FYI)
- The py27 job is missing neutron as a dependant project [2]. This
patch explicitly adds it as a dependency.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/vmware-nsx/stable/pike/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/1460303/job-output.txt.gz
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/vmware-nsx/stable/pike/openstack-tox-py35/2ba7e44/job-output.txt.gz

Change-Id: Ia376d0c552911cf7dc2686734daa0c2e30540808

commit_message:
vmware-nsx grafana dashboard

This patch adds a grafana dashboard for the vmware-nsx project. The
dashboard shows the failure rates for:
- master gate/check py27/py35 jobs
- stable/pike py27/py35 jobs
- stable/ocata py27/py35 jobs

Change-Id: Iad98a4fe898b097bd14084ea52aed7a5c674658a

commit_message:
Change the gate/checks to py3 only for python3 only charms

These are:
- charm-ceph-osd
- charm-heat
- charm-neutron-api
- charm-neutron-gateway
- charm-neutron-openvswitch
- charm-nova-compute
and:
- charm-barbican
- charm-barbican-softhsm
- charm-manila
- charm-manila-generic
- charm-designate
- charm-designate-bind
- charm-keystone-ldap
- charm-openvswitch-odl
- charm-tempest

Change-Id: Ieb85a6104654b741675f296978a249403767a5a2

tools/tox_install.sh, we can build without it.
