(4 comments)

Two major points from my side:

o What I understand is, that mixing grub and extlinux in the bootloader element is a kind of 'accident'; therefore the bootloader might get split up in future. Why do you not create a separate element for zipl boot?

o In general I cannot give a +1/+2 for this patch, because this is something that is not supported (aka tested) in DIB CI (and I also have no s390 around here :-) ). Would it be possible that you add a test case and provide an environment where it can be tested?"}, {'account_id': 23745, 'date': '2017-03-10 08:59:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Andreas, thank you for your comments and remarks. Initially let me provide one piece of information. This patch is not intended to sort out any previously introduced issues, but rather to make something work, that didn't work before.

o ...Why do you not create a separate element for zipl boot?
- Because this patch is not intended to sort out previously introduced issues.

o Would it be possible that you add a test case and provide an environment where it can be tested?
- While it might be difficunt to add an s390x machine to the DIB testing environment, there is access to s390x machines available at https://developer.ibm.com/linuxone/ Feel free to get an account there and test the patches beyond our verification, that this patch is allowing us to use DIB for building s390x images that can be instantiated, which was impossible before.

diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/finalise.d/50-bootloader
Line 12:
- This is not a line introduced by me. This patch is not intended to clean up issues that have been introduced previously.

Line 15:
- This is what I call defensive programming: if you create code to solve a particular problem, make sour your code is not accidentally used for anything else. That prevents people from opening bugs against assumed features that are not supposed to work.

Line 17:
- Really, there is code in HEAD, that does not work any longer? Let us investigate, whether the proposed patch (rebase of 386031) will still work on HEAD.

Line 70:
In general: using parted here is a bad idea;
- Let us investigate how to do this the right way.

...the only thing that needs to be done here is to add a command to get this information to the outside.
- I'd be happy to use the output of this command. The intention of this patch is not to solve any issues or close any gaps of previously introduced code.

I'd prefer to have different patchsets with appropriate titles: One to sort out previously introduced accidents (like the mix of extlinux and grub). One to close functional gaps in regard to new APIs and ways to do things right, and one to enable the s390x architecture. Maybe you work on the first two, and I'll adjust my s390 enablement patch as appropriate against HEAD?"}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-03-10 21:52:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Holger, thanks for your reply.  It looks that there are some
misunderstandings.

The current version of diskimage-builder was released in the middle of
a major refactoring of the block device layer - the not yet merged
half is currently in review [1].  As soon as this is merged the rest
of the source code will be cleaned up and adapted to the new block
device handler.  (Also there is already a LVM element started which
makes use of the new block device layer [2].)

Your patch now comes 
o based on an element which needs major refactoring (and which
  includes 'by accident' two bootloaders)
o and uses the old and deprecated API.

Of course you are interested in bringing in your new feature - and
this is highly appreciated.  But please use the new way of handling
things.

Please note that there is (as far as I know) nothing that does
currently not work.

>o ... Why do you not create a separate element for zipl boot?
>  Because this patch is not intended to sort out previously
>  introduced issues.

This is not a question of previously introduced issues but about
design.  There is already (at least one) other element that implements
a boot loader: uboot.  Why should we make the same error a second time
and mix in another bootloader here?

> While it might be difficunt to add an s390x machine to the DIB
>   testing environment, there is access to s390x machines available
>   at https://developer.ibm.com/linuxone/ Feel free to get an account
>   there and test the patches beyond our verification, that this
>   patch is allowing us to use DIB for building s390x images that can
>   be instantiated, which was impossible before.

Typically for new code we need / want test cases.  What I understood
is, that your patch builds images *for* a s390.  But as for other
systems, there should be the possibility to create the images *on* a
different machine.  So maybe there is a way to create a test that can
be run on a 'normal' amd64 system?  (The optimal way would of course
to really boot the image on the target platform, but it might be that
this does not really fit into the current CI.)

> Line 15:
> This is what I call defensive programming: if you create code to solve
> a particular problem, make sour your code is not accidentally used for
> anything else. That prevents people from opening bugs against assumed
> features that are not supposed to work.

Yes - you are completely right.  The 'use' of the variable
IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICE was one reason why I started the whole block device
refactoring... As said before: this is *last* element where this is
used - and will be removed as soon as the bootloader element is
refactored.

> Line 17:
> Really, there is code in HEAD, that does not work any longer? Let us
> investigate, whether the proposed patch (rebase of 386031) will still
> work on HEAD.

As I said: Of course is (currently) works - but will not in short
term.

> Line 70: In general: using parted here is a bad idea;
>   Let us investigate how to do this the right way.

IMHO the output of parted might change.  When there is the need to
read partition entries using bash, there is 'partx --raw': fixed and
well defined output, no assumptions, no awk, ...

> I'd be happy to use the output of this command. The intention of
> this patch is not to solve any issues or close any gaps of previously
> introduced code.

No - not this time ;-)
The information you need here are very special and not needed for
other boot loaders.  When I understand you correctly you need the
block size.  This is available in
diskimage_builder/block_device/level1/partitioning.py - takes some
minutes to implement a query for this (and some hours to get merged ;-))

What I do not understand is from which block device you need the
offset?  (Offset in sectors?)  Is it for the boot device (where the
bootloader can find the kernel and the ramdisk) or of the root device?
What should be given here when the boot / root partition is a logical
volume?  Does s390x support booting from md or encrypted devices?
(Just to know, because this might also be implemented in
diskimage-builder.)

BTW: why are you computing the offset in line 74 which is then never
used? 

> I'd prefer to have different patchsets with appropriate titles:

Yes - of course.

> Maybe you work on the first two, and I'll adjust my s390 enablement
> patch as appropriate against HEAD?

Nice try; how much do you pay ;-) ?

At first the second part of the refactoring needs to be merged - and
some small adjustments need to be added / fixed.  And then the most
urgent features requested from customers...

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/426618/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/444403/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/418204/"}, {'account_id': 23745, 'date': '2017-03-13 08:55:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, Andreas, for the clarification. I now better understand the situation. Admittedly it is difficult for me (for various reasons) to code against moving targets.
I appreciate your suggestion to move the s390x code from 50-bootloader to a separate element for s390x-zipl and also using the new APIs and way of thing, once they will be integrated. I prefer to pursue integration of this patch after that and will abandon it for now.'}, {'account_id': 25545, 'date': '2017-03-24 10:12:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I was able to figure out why the symlink /boot/vmlinuz and /boot/initrd.img where not created when the ubuntu-minimal distro is used:

The symlinks get installed by the postinstall script of the linux-image-xxx-generic package. They actually get created, but under / and not under /boot/. To fix this one must adapt the /etc/kernel-img.conf and add the line

  link_in_boot = yes

@zdeng, any suggestions on how to do that?'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-09-22 11:05:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-09-22 11:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Seems like I'm taking over this patch. I fixed the issue with the ubuntu-minimal build. Now ubuntu and ubuntu-minimal are working.

@Andreas Florath: Are there still some blockers for this patch to merge? I saw that some of the refactorings you planned got abandoned (at least the referenced patches got)

Unfortunately cross platform testing is not possible (as there's no s390x qemu emulator support - only kvm which requires a corresponding HW). But I could set up a Third Party CI. Do you have any recommendations which jobs such a CI should implement?

Something else: Is there a way to automatically pick the element "zipl" when the build runs on arch s390x? At the moment the zipl element needs to be specified explicitly

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-22 12:24:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

- gate-dsvm-nodepool-redhat-src http://logs.openstack.org/48/443548/7/check/gate-dsvm-nodepool-redhat-src/9f8342a/ : SUCCESS in 1h 11m 15s
- gate-dsvm-nodepool-ubuntu-src http://logs.openstack.org/48/443548/7/check/gate-dsvm-nodepool-ubuntu-src/9666d33/ : SUCCESS in 33m 57s
- gate-dsvm-nodepool-opensuse-src http://logs.openstack.org/48/443548/7/check/gate-dsvm-nodepool-opensuse-src/1f0eb5b/ : SUCCESS in 28m 39s'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-26 10:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Build succeeded (check-tripleo pipeline).

- gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq http://logs.openstack.org/48/443548/7/check-tripleo/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq/d9c6b2c/ : SUCCESS in 2h 31m 57s'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-10-06 03:26:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

So AIUI, what this element is doing is calling the zipl tool, which calls out to zipl_helper.blkext which does ... what?  probes /proc devices to find what it thinks is the boot device?

how does this interact with the "vm" element, or the partitioning that dib-block-device is doing? presumably it just uses the default setup?

does the new-ish export of $IMAGE_BLOCK_DEVICES help at all?  can you use that to find the boot device?

probably, the "bootloader" element should be called something like "grub" and be a partner to something like this (and i'm not sure anyone uses extlinux?  that's probably a dead codepath).  i'm not sure it is worth it.

I feel like, modulo any license issues, this is probably ok for me'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-10-06 11:58:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@zgdeng: Can you jump in?

Regarding the helper script - you wrote it on your own, right? If so, I can take the task of updating the license header..'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-10-09 12:35:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Zipl is a replacement for grub (grub is not available on s390x). When called, it requires the information provided by the helper file to write the boot sectors correctly. An extra helper file is required as the operating system shipped helper file only works for scsi but not for the loop device used during DIB process.

Putting this on hold until I was able to clarify the rest of the questions...'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-10-18 09:05:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

@Ian: you were right - the zipl helper file includes parts that are under the MIT license. The right approach to deal with it would be to include the MIT license HEADER and the license itself into the source file (or the global LICENSE file) [1][2]. Would that be ok from the DIB project point of view? Or do you suggest to find a different solution (e.g. asking the author to re-licens the code to apache, or rewrite it totally new). Any suggestions?
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LegalIssuesFAQ
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/legal-discuss/2013-April/000002.html'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-10-19 11:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-10-19 12:00:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I figured out that everything is working even without the helper file. Tried ubuntu and ubuntu-minimal. I also tried a multi partition setup (hosting boot on the second partition).
@zgdeng: Was there a certain scenario where this magic was required?'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-10-19 14:35:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 21741, 'date': '2017-10-21 06:03:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

I see three major issues here:

1) Building only a (very limited) set of target systems
As fas as I see only Ubuntu is supported. This is at least 'unusual'. IMHO as long as the system / distro supports the feature it should also be supported by DIB.

2) Building only on s390x
This is a discontinuation of the current philosophy of DIB where the goal is to create any target on any host.

3) Testing
From what I see is, that you don't provide any test cases.  Also IMHO there is no s390x in CI or gating: what are your ideas about fixing problems and possible future regressions for this element?

There are a couple of minor issues, like (what I see from the documentation / discussion) that zipl replaces grub but what I see from the code is that zipl is installed additionally to grub (cannot really test this, because I do not have access to an s390x...)

So for me it looks that this element should be part of an inhouse or project repo and not of DIB."}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-10-23 07:52:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Hi Andreas, thanks for your response! Let me try to answer your questions:

1) Building only a (very limited) set of target systems
I'm not making any support statement ;) It's just about what has been tested - at the moment only with ubuntu. Let me do some research and provide you a summary of what is working and what is not. In most cases, the <distro>*-minimal image will probably work, but not the pure <distro> element, as those distros are not providing a s390x.qcow2 image (only ubuntu does AFAIK). But this is a TBD on my side. The first idea was to start with ubuntu and then extend it step by step to other distros.

2) Building only on s390x
The feature to build images cross arch is based on qemu, right? The issue is, that there is no qemu emulator for the s390x cpu itself (other hardware like s390x NICs is of course supported by qemu). The only way to start a VM is using KVM for the CPU and qemu for the rest. Therefore cross arch building will never work. It might be possible to build x86 images from a s390x host, but not vice versa. And it probably never will....

3) Testing
Are you talking about test cases for the zipl element? I still need to understand how tests for DIB actually work...
Regarding CI - we already have a nova and devstack third party CI for s390x running. It would be easy to extend it to also listen on DIB changes. A new job could then build images on s390x... As this CI would be maintained by IBM, I suggest to NOT make it blocking (voting -2). This is how it is in nova. If a patch fails, it's up to the thirdparty CI team to follow up the issues. Would that be sufficient?


Regarding the minor issues:
Yes, zipl replaces grub. The zipl element provides "bootloader" (via the element-provides file). So if explicitly given, the bootloader element (which contains grub) will not be executed but zipl will instead. Alternatively we could include the zipl in the bootloader directly. I'm open for suggestions.

Having a separate repository hosting this element would be another valid approach. But our primary goal is to integrate it in DIB itself.  

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-02 06:28:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Sorry, I've owed reviews on this for too long.  I saw it in the meeting log for tomorrow (my time) but due to summit I won't be able to run that.

I'm glad the alternatively licensed stuff seems to have gone, that's one big hurdle out of the way

I do wonder a bit about this, let's face it almost nobody is going to be able to use a s390x system and actually try anything useful with this.

The only "interface" this is using is DIB_ROOT_LABEL right, to get the root device from the bootloader setup?  

Why don't we try setting up s390 reporting like powerkvm?  at least then we know it builds, or have logs if it's not.

What's the use case ... why did you put all this work in?  For making nodepool type images?  Or for use with ironic or something?  Maybe it lives more naturally in there.  I don't have a huge problem with it going into dib here if that seems like the best place after we've thought about what it's being used for'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-11-06 09:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

yes, DIB_ROOT_LABEL is the only interface.

yes, my idea was to provide a thirdparty CI for s390x, which would build the image and provide logs (like we do for nova).

The use case is the same as for x86. Nova has support for s390x libvirt/kvm and we want people to be able to build images for it. Another use case is the nodeopool image build (at the moment I have this patch patched in our third party ci to allow nodepool building s390x images).

Regarding distro support (Andreas asked for this). There are 3 supported distros for s390x
- RHEL (support needs to be worked out)
- SLES (not integrated in DIB)
- Ubuntu (support added by this patch)
Other distros are not (officially) supported on the platform'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-11-06 15:56:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Regarding Distro support on s390x. I just realized the following: RHEL is not supported at all on s390x kvm :( Only SLES and Ubuntu are. As building a SLES image is not part of DIB, only Ubuntu will be supported on s390x. I'll update the commit message with the next version of the patch"}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-11-07 15:44:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-11-07 16:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Another question: Do you guys think that this should be a separate element, or shall we merge it into the bootloader element? Second would blow up the bootloader element a bit, but would make things better consumeable for users...'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-11-07 16:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11307, 'date': '2017-11-07 16:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

BTW, the zipl_helper file was required for the non-partitioned setup. I rewrote it in bash to exactly match our use case (now its 5 lines of bash code again ;)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-20 03:51:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

After thinking about it, I think this meets enough of a bar to be in dib.  It only uses values exported by the block-device layer, so it could in theory just be kept anywhere -- but the bootloader is also pretty fundamental so I think we're better keeping things together in case we need to fiddle and we can do it all in the same tree (say as we get better with UEFI etc).  Also if anything we should be splitting the existing bootloader element out further, so merging into there isn't appropriate."}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-11-30 20:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2017-12-01 00:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}]

s390x architecture uses zipl as bootloader. When used in combination

It's mandatory for s390x vm images.

Use cases
---------

* Allow users to create s390x images that run on nova with s390x
  libvirt/kvm backend
* Building nodepool images for s390x third party CI

Supported Distros
-----------------
The following listing shows all Distros that officially support
s390x and how those Distros are supported in DIB with this patch.

* SLES - not supported (SLES is not supported in DIB)
* RHEL - not suppoprted (RHEL is not supported as KVM guest on s390x,
                         therefore there's no rhel7 qcow image for s390x available
                         like it is for other archictectures)
* Ubuntu - supported

Ubuntu images can for example be built using the following commands:

  $ disk-image-create ubuntu-minimal zipl vm
  $ disk-image-create ubuntu zipl vm

Testing
-------

Cross architecture building of s390x images is not supported so far.

The plan is to set up a ThirdParty CI that builds the image for s390x and
provides the logs.

commit_message:
Add zipl element as s390x architecture bootloader

s390x architecture uses zipl as bootloader. When used in combination
with the vm element it replaces the existing bootloader element.
It's mandatory for s390x vm images.

Use cases
---------

* Allow users to create s390x images that run on nova with s390x
  libvirt/kvm backend
* Building nodepool images for s390x third party CI

Supported Distros
-----------------
The following listing shows all Distros that officially support
s390x and how those Distros are supported in DIB with this patch.

* SLES - not supported (SLES is not supported in DIB)
* RHEL - not suppoprted (RHEL is not supported as KVM guest on s390x,
                         therefore there's no rhel7 qcow image for s390x available
                         like it is for other archictectures)
* Ubuntu - supported

Ubuntu images can for example be built using the following commands:

  $ disk-image-create ubuntu-minimal zipl vm
  $ disk-image-create ubuntu-minimal zipl
  $ disk-image-create ubuntu zipl vm

Testing
-------

Cross architecture building of s390x images is not supported so far.

The plan is to set up a ThirdParty CI that builds the image for s390x and
provides the logs.

Co-Authored-By: Andreas Scheuring <andreas.scheuring@de.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Holger Smolinsky <holger@smolinski.name>
Co-Authored-By: Zhiguo Deng <bjzgdeng@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Co-Authored-By: Arne Recknagel <arne.recknagel@hotmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1730641

Change-Id: I576e7edda68da12e97c60af38f457915efe7b934

commit_message:
Make tox runnable in a directory with spaces

I noticed a disturbing lack of quote-wrapping in change
I7cb4b44952713752435e1faf0f63bf0d37e7dda6 but as I poked at it, I
realized that trouble runs rampant.

This seems to clean it all up, though I haven't tested *every*
environment we define.

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-23 19:02:08.000000000', 'message': 'Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

As explained in bug [1] when l3 agent fails to report state to the
server, its state is set to AGENT_REVIVED, triggering
fetch_and_sync_all_routers, which will set all its HA network ports
to DOWN, resulting in
1) ovs agent rewiring these ports and setting status to ACTIVE
2) when these ports are active, server sends router update to l3 agent
As server, ovs and l3 agents are busy with this processing, l3 agent
may fail again reporting state, repeating this process.

As l3 agent is repeatedly processing same routers, SIGHUPs are
frequently sent to keepalived, resulting in multiple masters.

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent
start instead of calling from fetch_and_sync_all_routers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1731595/comments/7

Change-Id: Ia9d5549f7d53b538c9c9f93fe6aa71ffff15524a
Related-bug: #1597461
Closes-Bug: #1731595

commit_message:
Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

As explained in bug [1] when l3 agent fails to report state to the
server, its state is set to AGENT_REVIVED, triggering
fetch_and_sync_all_routers, which will set all its HA network ports
to DOWN, resulting in
1) ovs agent rewiring these ports and setting status to ACTIVE
2) when these ports are active, server sends router update to l3 agent
As server, ovs and l3 agents are busy with this processing, l3 agent
may fail again reporting state, repeating this process.

As l3 agent is repeatedly processing same routers, SIGHUPs are
frequently sent to keepalived, resulting in multiple masters.

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent
start instead of calling from fetch_and_sync_all_routers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1731595/comments/7

Change-Id: Ia9d5549f7d53b538c9c9f93fe6aa71ffff15524a
Related-bug: #1597461
Closes-Bug: #1731595

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-23 16:58:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix drivers_private_data update on deleted entries

The drivers_private_data is expected to be able to
save new entries using the same keys as previously deleted
entries.

Before performing an update, it retrieves all entries
related to the same entity to check if it needs to
perform an update (including on deleted entries) or a
new insertion.

Unfortunately, the misinterpretation of a parameter in the
manila DB API led to a bug that prevented deleted entries
to be retrieved.

This bugfix replaces the query ensuring that all entries
(active and deleted) are retrieved so the update validation
works.

Closes-bug: #1721123

Change-Id: Id94544c9b8a534d7f0fe4e16bc57546002e33373

commit_message:
Fix drivers_private_data update on deleted entries

The drivers_private_data is expected to be able to
save new entries using the same keys as previously deleted
entries.

Before performing an update, it retrieves all entries
related to the same entity to check if it needs to
perform an update (including on deleted entries) or a
new insertion.

Unfortunately, the misinterpretation of a parameter in the
manila DB API led to a bug that prevented deleted entries
to be retrieved.

This bugfix replaces the query ensuring that all entries
(active and deleted) are retrieved so the update validation
works.

Closes-bug: #1721123

Change-Id: Id94544c9b8a534d7f0fe4e16bc57546002e33373

commit_message:
Add legacy murano-dsvm-functional job

The Zuul v3 migration missed to add this job. Add it and rename
the CI set up.

Also, fix existing zuul config and use .yaml extension for all jobs,
this will soon be required.

Change-Id: I82b22e60834590a9bf01af5a81d88b287cef9ed0

commit_message:
Redis replication does not work with TLS

Lets revert the tls support until we know it works.

Revert "Enable redis TLS proxy in HA deployments"

This reverts commit c6d8df01d7aa8b44af9ac152b3bb08f07e2e02b7.

Closes-bug: #1735259

Change-Id: If98acec1b8d0a179d56b8412e5c0ad9341719cea

commit_message:
Redis replication does not work with TLS

Lets revert the tls support until we know it works.

Revert "TLS proxy for redis"

This reverts commit c2a93cf4c5d9d6b5ee0536380751a7a9540927cc.

Closes-bug: #1735259

Change-Id: I8157ce04617c094978175f3e4b3071bdf76362fe

commit_message:
Allow images to be filtered by project ID

A new parameter MURANO_IMAGE_FILTER_PROJECT_ID has been added which, when
given, will filter the list of public Murano images to the given project
ID. Private images owned by the user are also included.

Change-Id: I20ad609e48cc786f46214efc0d308b8d1b0f6ea9
Closes-Bug: #1717439

subject: Add ComputeAlt role and environment
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 22:20:26.000000000', 'message': "Add ComputeAlt role and environment

In order to support compute services ppc64le, which currently don't
have supported methods for building and distributing container images,
we create a role 'ComputeAlt' which directly uses the puppet/services
templates to configure services that would typically be containers.

This new role is supposed to minimally diverge from the Compute role.

The following services have been switch for the puppet versions:
 - OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeCeilometerAgent
 - OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronOvsAgent
 - OS::TripleO::Services::Iscsid
 - OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronSriovAgentAlt
 - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaCompute
 - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaLibvirt
 - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaMigrationTarget

The following services have been removed as they're only available as
docker containers:
 - OS::TripleO::Services::Docker
 - OS::TripleO::Services::ContainersLogrotateCrond

Alternate versions for the following services are configured, they are
left as OS::Heat::None the operator will need to define them
appropriately if they're needed:
 - OS::TripleO::Services::Collectd
 - OS::TripleO::Services::FluentdClient
 - OS::TripleO::Services::SensuClient
 - OS::TripleO::Services::OVNController

NOTE(tonyb): This differs from the queens version as:
 - Idb9886f04d56ffc75a78c4059ff319b58b4acf9f
   (logging: merge fluentd-client and fluentd-base)
 - I2c54acaaa820961c936f1fbe304f42162f720496
   (Add rsyslog-sidecar resource and configuration)

are, currently, queens only.

Change-Id: I31d673dd048f687c9125733a77d0c9e6069e0614
(cherry picked from commit cfcbf3d8a0bb60fee85fdb465510a79c4e30e3a0)
"}]
commit_message:
Add ComputeAlt role and environment

In order to support compute services ppc64le, which currently don't
have supported methods for building and distributing container images,
we create a role 'ComputeAlt' which directly uses the puppet/services
templates to configure services that would typically be containers.

This new role is supposed to minimally diverge from the Compute role.

The following services have been switch for the puppet versions:
 - OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeCeilometerAgent
 - OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeNeutronOvsAgent
 - OS::TripleO::Services::Iscsid
 - OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronSriovAgentAlt
 - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaCompute
 - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaLibvirt
 - OS::TripleO::Services::NovaMigrationTarget

The following services have been removed as they're only available as
docker containers:
 - OS::TripleO::Services::Docker
 - OS::TripleO::Services::ContainersLogrotateCrond

Alternate versions for the following services are configured, they are
left as OS::Heat::None the operator will need to define them
appropriately if they're needed:
 - OS::TripleO::Services::Collectd
 - OS::TripleO::Services::FluentdClient
 - OS::TripleO::Services::SensuClient
 - OS::TripleO::Services::OVNController

NOTE(tonyb): This differs from the queens version as:
 - Idb9886f04d56ffc75a78c4059ff319b58b4acf9f
   (logging: merge fluentd-client and fluentd-base)
 - I2c54acaaa820961c936f1fbe304f42162f720496
   (Add rsyslog-sidecar resource and configuration)

are, currently, queens only.

Change-Id: I31d673dd048f687c9125733a77d0c9e6069e0614
(cherry picked from commit cfcbf3d8a0bb60fee85fdb465510a79c4e30e3a0)

commit_message:
Don't fail Kubespray scenario if swap is enabled

We have swap enabled in CI, by default Kubespray refuses to run with
swap, and so does Kubelet. Make this behavior configurable and allow
swap in the Kubespray scenario env file. It should be fine to run with
swap for development/testing [1].

[1] https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/kubespray/issues/1787#issuecomment-336159788

Depends-On: I7a02134970c1b1754d42c4e85ed0a2188a5ecdb6
Change-Id: I023824a31f1278b01c33ce81d4af81247dd5f672

commit_message:
Pass private key file from parent Ansible to Kubespray

The private key file is not part of the inventory in our case, but
it's a global Ansible parameter. Make sure that we carry the same
--private-key parameter from parent Ansible run into Kubespray.

Change-Id: If6e341ee52f9d4944ee1855d3339e26b9a485dd0

subject: Stop creating kubectl binary on undercloud
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages: [{'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2017-11-28 15:05:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2017-11-28 19:07:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-30 03:13:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 15:05:06.000000000', 'message': "Stop creating kubectl binary on undercloud

Doing this was useful for playing with Kubespray, but it's suboptimal
for multiple reasons:

1. It gets generated into artifacts directory which we collect for CI
   logs. It has around 220 megabytes, which would be very bad for log
   collection space usage. Even if Kubespray made the location
   configurable, mistral user's external_deploy_tasks don't have
   rights to write it e.g. into /usr/local/bin, so usefulness of doing
   this at all is questionable.

2. Kubectl on the undercloud, it would ideally be preinstalled via
   RPMs rather than relying on the respective COE installers to
   produce one by fetching it from the overcloud.

Change-Id: Ia7faeb13537adfc3326302d26965439f5603c5a8
"}]
commit_message:
Stop creating kubectl binary on undercloud

Doing this was useful for playing with Kubespray, but it's suboptimal
for multiple reasons:

1. It gets generated into artifacts directory which we collect for CI
   logs. It has around 220 megabytes, which would be very bad for log
   collection space usage. Even if Kubespray made the location
   configurable, mistral user's external_deploy_tasks don't have
   rights to write it e.g. into /usr/local/bin, so usefulness of doing
   this at all is questionable.

2. Kubectl on the undercloud, it would ideally be preinstalled via
   RPMs rather than relying on the respective COE installers to
   produce one by fetching it from the overcloud.

Change-Id: Ia7faeb13537adfc3326302d26965439f5603c5a8

commit_message:
Fix galera server local db permission access

This corrects the permissions we grant to root allowing it access
everywhere. Sadly the more restrictive approach was causing issues
everywhere.

Change-Id: I3c1b755e4bed6a209c127258b79d3ef557caf19e
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Make create env show the correct error message

Now create env with null name or space only show:
"This field is required" error message,
didn't show the correct message:
"Environment name must contain at least one non-white space symbol."
This will also fix the dashboard functional test cases
about create env.

Change-Id: I4f2be3320eeb02e0d0953eee8426cc5aae685865
Closes-Bug: #1735035

commit_message:
Add validation task in docker services [Horizon]

Docker services are missing the pre-upgrade validation task
in the upgrade_tasks section which verifies if the service
is running before going on with the upgrade.

Change-Id: Ib30826c41489cb22174cc083a01c3c3b091f3fe3
Partial-Bug: #1704389

commit_message:
Set notification_format to 'unversioned'

Currently there is no consumer for the versioned notification format,
which results in messages queueing up for infinite time.  Until we
have a consumer for the 'versioned' format, we set it to
'unversioned'.

Closes-Bug: #1734185
Depends-On: Id08b2d5a1e87825b182e767bffc4c15e5ce9968f
Change-Id: I5be547acbd1245de42572941d2185863697f89bd
(cherry picked from commit 1624e1cf19b19b4342fe143753df1fa030593294)

commit_message:
Add overcloud-ssl task to bm undercloud playbook

This commit adds the overcloud-ssl task to the baremetal undercloud
playbook, this will make playbook suitable for testing also SSL on the
overcloud which was not available before.

Change-Id: Ia4b15c7d2d6c4cd28469fa2d9912d0ef41d97e7b

commit_message:
Fix typo in tempest-results

The correct variable is tempestmail_log_server instead of
tempestmail_log_url.

Also, removing the conditional in --log-url because it's set in the defaults.

Change-Id: I46eb94c04aa0a639caf87d4dc6b923e53f80d0b0

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be

    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more

"Another thread already created a resource provider with
the UUID d494e537-0790-4dfd-9ca2-28905e085f58" in nova logs,

commit_message:
correct the resource provider log when return 409

When installed a new computenode with the same hostname,
new nova-compute has wrong warning logs:
"Another thread already created a resource provider with
the UUID d494e537-0790-4dfd-9ca2-28905e085f58" in nova logs,
but in fact, no record with this uuid in database.
I find that in resource_providers table, set name and uuid
unique key. So when try inserting the same name or uuid,
sqlalchemy will return 409. Functional tests in gabbits also
show this.
It's not a good idea to change table keys or delete existed
record at present, so I only correct logs for this problem.

Change-Id: I783ac2e41e3e56cffb4474b37af1c6cd9d25c382
Closes-Bug: #1733254

subject: Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 19:48:59.000000000', 'message': "Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I932ac6a96f0088532e1db7c05bd513647b61ae62
"}]
commit_message:
Remove setting of version/release from releasenotes

Release notes are version independent, so remove version/release
values. We've found that projects now require the service package
to be installed in order to build release notes, and this is entirely
due to the current convention of pulling in the version information.

Release notes should not need installation in order to build, so this
unnecessary version setting needs to be removed.

This is needed for new release notes publishing, see
I56909152975f731a9d2c21b2825b972195e48ee8 and the discussion starting
at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-November/124480.html
.

Change-Id: I932ac6a96f0088532e1db7c05bd513647b61ae62

  rw,nosuid,noexec,relatime,gid=5,mode=620,ptmxmode=000
* code duplication
* Using the undocumented and non-robust output
  of 'mount'.

This patch fixed the above problems.

Change-Id: Ib0c7358772480c56d405659a6a32afd60c311686
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Fix /dev/pts mount options handling

The current implementation - as introduced in
Iee44703297a15b14c715f4bfb7bae67f613aceee - has some shortcomings / bugs,
like:

* the 'grep' check is too sloppy
* when /dev/pts is already mounted multiple times the current implementation
  fails:
  $ mount | grep devpts | sed 's/.*(\(.*\))/\1/'
  rw,nosuid,noexec,relatime,gid=5,mode=620,ptmxmode=000
  rw,nosuid,noexec,relatime,gid=5,mode=620,ptmxmode=000
  rw,nosuid,noexec,relatime,gid=5,mode=620,ptmxmode=000
* code duplication
* Using the undocumented and non-robust output
  of 'mount'.

This patch fixed the above problems.

Change-Id: Ib0c7358772480c56d405659a6a32afd60c311686
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Remove documentation about USE_CONSTRAINTS

The USE_CONSTRAINTS configuration variable was removed from DevStack
more than two years ago, however the requirements README was still
referencing it.

This patch also fixes the capitalization of DevStack throughout the
file.

Change-Id: I0ee4db73b0b6859c0f8a2c6b4a22befb98bcd928

commit_message:
Update the basic systemd extra configs for isolation and consistency

For the sake of consistency the "systemd" prefix was added to the
without-privatedevices.conf file.

A new configuration file has been added which will further isolate
our services using a named cgroup; this is similar to what we already do in
our openstack services. By further isolating the service from the system
we get quite a bit more control and accountability.

Change-Id: I5707ef318341259b086a5f1d49656fd0d1c7f269
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
[placement] Add 'CUSTOM_' prefix description in API ref

In the following resource class APIs,
the name of a resource class must start with 'CUSTOM_'.
If not, the request returns a 'Bad Request (400)' response code.
It should be described in the API reference. So add it.

* POST /resource_classes
* PUT /resource_classes/{name}

Change-Id: I132c532678bb74a460515067187fbf1e30885335
Closes-Bug: #1733308

commit_message:
[placement] Fix parameter order in placement API ref

Optional parameters should be after required paramenters.
Parameters added in microversions should be after
original parameters.
So fix them.

Change-Id: I5e3f5df5601d3747debed273e09a8b9b18046a96
Closes-Bug: #1728557

commit_message:
[placement] Fix format in placement API ref

In "Delete traits" API of Placement API reference,
the format of response codes description is wrong.
"409 Conflict if the name to delete has associations with any"
is bold, but "ResourceProvider." is not.
So fix it.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I963c350bfc339d4db769b0bfd6bba1087fa065e0

code. This will prevent running the database schema migrations

Change-Id: I2b04b785c71c6f2cc825215e2773a00e85a67a89

commit_message:
Use NoDBTestCase for powervm driver tests

TestCase is being replaced by NoDBTestCase for the powervm driver test
code. This will prevent running the database schema migrations
unnecessarily and will let the developer know if the tests touch the
DB when the test case is claiming that it shouldn't.

Change-Id: I2b04b785c71c6f2cc825215e2773a00e85a67a89

commit_message:
Fix incorrect known vcpuset when CPUPinningUnknown raised

When exception.CPUPinningUnknown or exception.CPUUnPinningUnknown
is raised, the value of known vcpuset is NUMACell's pinned_cpus,
it should be NUMACell's cpuset.

Close-Bug: #1729784
Change-Id: I1902dc40623af62fd83fac222099f664d7d19ed9

[{'created': '2016-09-30 17:03:11.000000000', 'message': 'Hyper-V: fix live migration with CSVs

In order to support live migrating instances placed on Cluster
Shared Volumes, we must explicitly tell os-win whether disks will
be migrated or not, ensuring that the right live migration type
will be requested.

Otherwise, the live migration will fail, Hyper-V complaining that
it could not move the instance disks (although this operation would
not be necessary).

Note that this was not a problem with other forms of shared storage
(for example having instance files on a SMB share), in which case
Hyper-V automatically detects that shared storage is being used.

Change-Id: Ic1949d48fe0de73a3de9417bc8462051e702a298

commit_message:
Hyper-V: fix live migration with CSVs

In order to support live migrating instances placed on Cluster
Shared Volumes, we must explicitly tell os-win whether disks will
be migrated or not, ensuring that the right live migration type
will be requested.

Otherwise, the live migration will fail, Hyper-V complaining that
it could not move the instance disks (although this operation would
not be necessary).

Note that this was not a problem with other forms of shared storage
(for example having instance files on a SMB share), in which case
Hyper-V automatically detects that shared storage is being used.

Change-Id: Ic1949d48fe0de73a3de9417bc8462051e702a298
Partial-Bug: #1565895

commit_message:
Fix wrong epel-release-7* package URL

When "epel" element is used during a build process
with "rhel7" distribution, the build failed
because the "epel-release-7*" package cannot be
installed.

The reason is because the URL is not correct, it
should be:
  URL=$BASE_URL/$RELEASE/x86_64/Packages/e/

Change-Id: I90c26892361f7611645b85f2eddc949b2f0d76fc
Closes-Bug: #1735547

commit_message:
Add `--converge` argument for osc stack update

This patch add `--converge` argument for osc stack update. This
flag will be used as the trigger for observe on reality.
implements bp get-reality-for-resources

depends-on: I151b575b714dcc9a5971a1573c126152ecd7ea93
Change-Id: If35e1b9234cab173b3c46601bbd331aceebcbcb3

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 15:07:44.000000000', 'message': "Fix broken nova console support

A patch of MKS console support replaces 'console' key into
'remote_console', but 'remote_console' key is only available
in Nova API version 2.6 or later. Horizon uses Nova API version
2.1 by default, so this change breaks the existing server console
support completely. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I656037511e0d80688df4b82fa8c77fe5c09402bd
Closes-Bug: #1735436
"}]
commit_message:
Fix broken nova console support

A patch of MKS console support replaces 'console' key into
'remote_console', but 'remote_console' key is only available
in Nova API version 2.6 or later. Horizon uses Nova API version
2.1 by default, so this change breaks the existing server console
support completely. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I656037511e0d80688df4b82fa8c77fe5c09402bd
Closes-Bug: #1735436

commit_message:
Change rewriteLinks to false

Set `$locationProvider.html5Mode` rewriteLinks to false,
otherwise the anchor links cannot function normally.

Change-Id: I28f286eace386b5300fe195eb5daa2f63e6a7b8f

commit_message:
Run ovb-ha with minimal services

We want to reduce the services tested by ovb-ha so we can use it to
validate overclouds can be deployed, test things that multinode can't do
now:
- HA
- net-iso
- ipv6 (will come later)
- TLS

So for that, we creating a new environment: https://review.openstack.org/522306
that will deploy a minimum list of services.
Note: for now we run the pingtest because we need https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522677/
to be promoted in RDO pipeline.

Change-Id: I58583f1699ce05b428f3b5bfdbc0bc99d1e4eecc
Depends-On: I865901f38250a13d8ea914a54072d6eb584a050d

commit_message:
Fix test_wait_timeout unit test

The test expects that `time.time` should be called 4 times from
wait_for_status method before TimeoutException will be raised.

It is still true, but `time.time` is also called by logging module, so
we are getting StopIteration exception.
It had happened after recent changes in oslo.logging module.

Co-Authored-By: Andrey Kurilin <andr.kurilin@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I6e8bc398f867e3b7fd6546d2eadfc44318754d0b

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I543399a944867e210e90e6149e616a82564d6323

commit_message:
Fix docs markup consistency

This commit fixes docs consistency about markups, mainly. Originally,
some of command options were written with strong emphasis. However,
double dashes are converted to a single dash with it. And this commit
also fixes some inconsistencies and weird indentations.

Change-Id: Iff1e8e320dcb1fa69ca0fce139c58727fca7b729

http://12.37.173.196:32775/repository/att-comdev-jenkins-logs/openstack-helm/org.openstack.helm/1829/org.openstack.helm-1829.x-gtar : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 11636, 'date': '2017-10-25 07:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Steve, I was trying to play with Nagios but unfortunately Nagios container fails with the following message:

  ## docker logs a02
  Starting pre-service scritps in /etc/my_init.d
  *** Running: /etc/my_init.d/startup.sh
  newaliases: fatal: /etc/mailname: file has 21 hard links

Have you encountered this issue?'}, {'account_id': 11636, 'date': '2017-10-25 10:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Well, it looks like adding the following lines to Dockerfile before "EXPOSE" section helps (or at least the container doesn't crash):

  RUN rm -f /etc/mailname
  RUN echo "example.com" > /etc/mailname

But now when I try to access Nagios UI, I get:

  220 8089fe031125.openstack.svc.cluster.local ESMTP Postfix (Ubuntu)
  221 2.7.0 Error: I can break rules, too. Goodbye.

Any tips for that? ;)'}, {'account_id': 11636, 'date': '2017-10-26 07:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11636, 'date': '2017-11-09 09:39:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

I haven't noticed that by default port 25 is exposed - that's why I was getting "221 2.7.0 Error: I can break rules, too. Goodbye." error when I was trying to access Nagios dashboard. Changing port to 80 fixed the issue.'}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2017-11-30 23:15:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2017-10-20 16:48:06.000000000', 'message': 'Add Nagios Chart for OpenStack-Helm

This introduces a Nagios chart for alerting in OpenStack-Helm. It
includes an image for Nagios modified to include the Prometheus
plugin for Nagios, which allows for the ability to trigger alarms
based off scalar and vector values in the Prometheus database.
This can be extended to include plugins specific to the services
in OSH, allowing for alerts based off the service metrics in cases
where the backing store for Prometheus is unavailable.

commit_message:
Add Nagios Chart for OpenStack-Helm

This introduces a Nagios chart for alerting in OpenStack-Helm. It
includes an image for Nagios modified to include the Prometheus
plugin for Nagios, which allows for the ability to trigger alarms
based off scalar and vector values in the Prometheus database.
This can be extended to include plugins specific to the services
in OSH, allowing for alerts based off the service metrics in cases
where the backing store for Prometheus is unavailable.

Change-Id: I073adac64a3ce1e857d4c75dd7313d690804fa90

commit_message:
Grafana Chart

Adds a grafana chart for use as part of the OpenStack-Helm
monitoring solution.  Can also be used with data sources
other than prometheus

Partially Implements: blueprint osh-monitoring

Change-Id: I6ca9ae8f41164c60b83aeca45fdb25e73ea9f31c

monitoring solution.  Can also be used with other data sources
other than prometheus

This is an epic change, Steve. Works great for me.  Either the gate script or the chart will need tweaking to deal with NFS setups, since the ceph namespace won't exist and the default ceph_exporter ns will cause a failure, but that should be a follow-on."}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2017-10-21 18:24:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 17:

> This is an epic change, Steve. Works great for me.  Either the gate
 > script or the chart will need tweaking to deal with NFS setups,
 > since the ceph namespace won't exist and the default ceph_exporter
 > ns will cause a failure, but that should be a follow-on.

Fair point Matt. I modified the startup to check if the pvc backend is ceph so we can disable the ceph_exporter manifest if required."}, {'account_id': 17591, 'date': '2017-10-21 18:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 26201, 'date': '2017-10-21 18:27:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-16 17:14:09.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - Prometheus Chart

This moves the Prometheus chart to OSH. Includes exporters for:
ceph, rabbitmq, mysql, and openstack. Also includes support for:
kube-state-metrics, cadvisor, and node-exporter

Partially Implements: blueprint osh-monitoring

Change-Id: I83c0f640d67419178a9874d340fe3f040381af4a
'}, {'created': '2017-10-17 02:18:57.000000000', 'message': 'Prometheus Chart

This moves the Prometheus chart to OSH. Includes exporters for:
ceph, rabbitmq, mysql, and openstack. Also includes support for:
kube-state-metrics, cadvisor, and node-exporter

Partially Implements: blueprint osh-monitoring

commit_message:
Prometheus Chart

This moves the Prometheus chart to OSH. Includes exporters for:
ceph, rabbitmq, mysql, and openstack. Also includes support for:
kube-state-metrics, cadvisor, and node-exporter

Partially Implements: blueprint osh-monitoring

Change-Id: I83c0f640d67419178a9874d340fe3f040381af4a

subject: Prometheus monitoring for OSH infra
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-03 16:00:24.000000000', 'message': 'WIP - Move prometheus to osh-infra

the basic infrastructure deploy for openstack-helm

commit_message:
Prometheus monitoring for OSH infra

This will move prometheus to OSH-infra to be included as part of
the basic infrastructure deploy for openstack-helm. It includes
charts for Prometheus, Node Exporter, Kube-State-Metrics, and
Alertmanager. It provides a base for monitoring and alerting
for the underlying infrastructure

Partially Implements: blueprint osh-monitoring

Change-Id: Ie453373b54c5f1825339ce0566e4b5d0f74abc20

commit_message:
Remove version arg from updated ironic calls

Based upon discusison and feedback in change
I783fd47db368035d283b4984e4daacf9dc4ac4bd,
I am removing the ability for the caller to
specify the version, as it is not presently
needed.

Change-Id: I14866a407f17849a6699c128ec999a9c71143e4c

handling of the namespace (creation, status), and namespace operations do
not run in the haproxy context

Force haproxy SELinux context in the main unit, as currently haproxy
runs in ifconfig_t domain. Also depend on the new network namespace unit

Task: 5831

commit_message:
Split amphora haproxy systemd unit

Move namespace handling to separate unit. This also allows a cleaner
handling of the namespace (creation, status), and namespace operations do
not run in the haproxy context

Force haproxy SELinux context in the main unit, as currently haproxy
runs in ifconfig_t domain. Also depend on the new network namespace unit

Story: 1646125
Task: 5831

Change-Id: Ic8bf097499b00ca32dcb501aadfda59755039194

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 21:45:03.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I0495c5e9066f0b364090854c2bb40a1bd28346cb
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I0495c5e9066f0b364090854c2bb40a1bd28346cb

Nova: Move placement API to run behind Apache

the recommended deployment method.

commit_message:
Remove workaround of initial neutron networks.

As br-ex issues are fixed on ODL side, there's configuration
lag on bringing br-ex before creation of initial networks.

Change-Id: Ifdb2053dc3fb55a406a298d074868baa3920f1ad

commit_message:
Use base as the parent job, not base-integration

The base-integration jobs are not meant to be used outside of the
context of testing the roles part of the base and multinode jobs [1].

Use base instead.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/524039/

Change-Id: I975107ae47e036853d586df15f8b3bf6d772faf4

[{'created': '2017-11-23 18:39:16.000000000', 'message': 'Align tox_install.sh with other projects

The tox_install.sh here behaves a bit differently than the others, which
is causing some problems when trying to rework some of the shared gate
jobs.

Align it to the form used in other repos.

Change-Id: I843c4e104c6d694074899912cbdf0332bfcf2a26
(cherry picked from commit 56f739de36bd9d0c0f3f7bc57240b115feefe3e9)
'}]
commit_message:
Align tox_install.sh with other projects

The tox_install.sh here behaves a bit differently than the others, which
is causing some problems when trying to rework some of the shared gate
jobs.

Align it to the form used in other repos.

Change-Id: I843c4e104c6d694074899912cbdf0332bfcf2a26
(cherry picked from commit 56f739de36bd9d0c0f3f7bc57240b115feefe3e9)

subject: Add more testing and increase build timeout for suse/cent
messages:
[{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-28 20:20:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-29 01:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-29 01:57:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-29 02:34:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-29 09:56:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-29 14:40:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (2 comments)

At present the issue is that the repo refresh can take a while for Cent and
SUSE, I even experience this on my normal workstation (openSUSE Tumbleweed)
from time to time. In trying to troubleshoot this issue I've observed in failed
builds where the timeout is reached but the logs indicate it was VERY near the
end of the container prep process but was killed by this task. Giving these
distros more time will help stabalize the gate, until we can figure our how to
make the repo refreshes happen faster. As for the integrated gate, the CentOS and
SUSE builds are non-voting and almost always timing out as-s so I'm less concerned 
about that at this time, I'm more concerned with the role tests passing. That 
said, I think with something like https://review.openstack.org/#/c/516002/ 
we'll be able to get everything passing eventually given the fact we'll test 
more scenarios in smaller builds."}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2017-11-30 05:50:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

I think this is ok if only to help reduce having to recheck role gates so often.
And, like Kevin mentioned, if the integrated repo's tests for these distros aren't failing out here they're timing out overall often anyway.

I do agree that 10 minutes is already pretty ridiculous for a single task though and this should definitely be optimized in some way, but for now less rechecking would be great.

Also, this comment should be removed
https://github.com/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts/blob/master/tasks/lxc_cache_preparation.yml#L112"}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-30 15:54:54.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-11-30 16:28:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-11-30 17:47:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-11-30 17:50:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
I've only ever seen the slowdown on suse and cent mirror refresh. However I'd be happy to make this change a global one if we think it best."}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2017-11-30 21:06:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I'm okay getting this in for now with a goal of reducing build time for SUSE/CentOS later on down the road."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 20:20:51.000000000', 'message': "Add more testing and increase build timeout for suse/cent

This adds more testing so we're doing everything we can combat
regressions across distros and all of our storage backends. To enure the
greatest possibility of consistent success when running the container prep
process the build timeout has been doubled for both SUSE and Cent.

For the SUSE prep-process the dbus-1 package has been added to the
installation list. This is being done for consistency across the distros
we support.

Change-Id: I481cfa36c8f6c5dbda09dadbcb3194c0052ed3f9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}, {'created': '2017-11-29 01:47:59.000000000', 'message': "Add more testing and increase build timeout for suse/cent

greatest possibility of consistent success when running the container prep

Depends-On: Ia4856f36b2d106d987e3c774f31493e25a23d4b5
Change-Id: I481cfa36c8f6c5dbda09dadbcb3194c0052ed3f9

commit_message:
Add more testing and increase build timeout for suse/cent

This adds more testing so we're doing everything we can combat
regressions across distros and all of our storage backends. To enure the
greatest possibility of consistent success when running the container prep
process the build timeout has been doubled for both SUSE and Cent.

For the SUSE prep-process the dbus-1 package has been added to the
installation list. This is being done for consistency across the distros
we support.

Depends-On: Ia4856f36b2d106d987e3c774f31493e25a23d4b5
Change-Id: I481cfa36c8f6c5dbda09dadbcb3194c0052ed3f9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: "Management" had a spelling error, this commit adds the missing character.
messages:
[{'account_id': 18279, 'date': '2017-11-30 20:22:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-11-30 20:23:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 10420, 'date': '2017-11-30 21:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Done! Ty for that.'}]

[{'created': '2017-11-23 17:11:54.000000000', 'message': "Create ovb-ha-ipv6 and deprecate fs024 job

- ovb-1ctlr_1comp_1ceph-featureset024 doesn't have much value
  since it doens't actually test stack updates, and also ceph is already
  covered by scenario001 and scenario004. So we'll stop running it from
  Queens and beyond.
- introduce ovb-ha-ipv6 which is the same job as ovb-ha but deploying
  an ipv6 overcloud with network isolation, TLS, containers,
  introspection and HA. I'll only run on Queens and beyond.

commit_message:
Create ovb-ha-ipv6 and deprecate fs024 job

- ovb-1ctlr_1comp_1ceph-featureset024 doesn't have much value
  since it doens't actually test stack updates, and also ceph is already
  covered by scenario001 and scenario004. So we'll stop running it from
  Queens and beyond.
  
- introduce ovb-ha-ipv6 which is the same job as ovb-ha but deploying
  an ipv6 overcloud with network isolation, TLS, containers,
  introspection and HA. I'll only run on Queens and beyond.

Depends-On: I3ddce91330352563d69c4ee896f157bd74158da0
Depends-On: I5235e3f29fdb129281c76f1c70135580f640a112
Change-Id: I92a144d0a1556293f25cdfcc865afdda6b603eb0

commit_message:
Spec: Add nginx sidecar

This specification proposes to add an nginx sidecar container to support
TLS offloading and termination.

Change-Id: I6d7e19539b5411d8ab15dc2d39e2051da1cce126
External-tracking: F#47

commit_message:
Add information about neutron ML2 drivers to multitenancy docs

This patch adds a place in the multitenancy/networking configuration
docs to talk about how to configure the Networking service with the
drivers required/compatible with Ironic.

commit_message:
Add additional capabilities discovery for iRMC driver

This update enhances iRMC out-of-band hardware inspection for
FUJITSU PRIMERGY bare metal nodes having iRMC S4 and beyond.

The capabilities are server_model, rom_firmware_version,
pci_gpu_devices, trusted_boot and irmc_firmware_version.

Co-authored-By: Nguyen Van Trung <trungnv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I1958e18a5b9d933e2aa405b200bac7717f146611
Closes-Bug: #1637422

The nova firewall driver validation currently runs on all Compute hosts, but
this will not work with composable roles that include the Compute role, but are

This patch lets the validation run on all hosts that use the nova_compute

Change-Id: I6607478c7045ef69f4764ebb1d65ff322bb26237

commit_message:
Change Nova firewall driver validation host

The nova firewall driver validation currently runs on all Compute hosts, but
this will not work with composable roles that include the Compute role, but are
not named as such.

This patch lets the validation run on all hosts that use the nova_compute
service.

Change-Id: I6607478c7045ef69f4764ebb1d65ff322bb26237

Checking build images log, i'd say it's not working as expected, i'm checking"}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2017-11-01 12:39:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2017-11-01 15:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

PS2 seems to be working as expected https://logs.rdoproject.org/65/516765/2/openstack-check/gate-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-1ctlr_1comp_1ceph-featureset024-master-nv/Z0533eb3599e04eaebf392b905046e201/undercloud/home/jenkins/overcloud_image_build.log.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2017-11-02 14:07:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-11-03 16:11:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2017-11-06 20:10:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Is https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/image-yaml/overcloud-images-centos7.yaml#L11 not installing it early enough then?  Maybe we should change when those explicitly listed packages get installed.'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2017-11-07 09:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Is https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/image-yaml/overcloud-images-centos7.yaml#L11
 > not installing it early enough then?  Maybe we should change when
 > those explicitly listed packages get installed.

The installation order for packages passed with "-p" option was change in diskimage-builder 2.3 [1], moving it from pre-install to install phase with the rest of packages. This broke yum-plugin-priorities as we need to get it installed before OpenStack packages, so i think the more appropiate fix is to move to openstack elements in pre-install step.

From the list of packages passed with -p in [2], i think yum-plugin-priorities is the only package in this situation.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/95503b42017a3b96f810e3195d8edaa64995ce78
[2] https://logs.rdoproject.org/openstack-periodic/periodic-tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-3ctlr_1comp-featureset002-master-upload/d2a5bd0/undercloud/home/jenkins/overcloud_image_build.log.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-29 23:59:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Install yum-plugin-priorities in pre-install phase

In some cases yum repositories are using priorities configuration
to force OpenStack packages to be installed from the desired
repository.

To work properly, priorities configuration requires the package
yum-plugin-priorities to be installed before doing the actual
OpenStack packages installation.

This patch adds yum-plugin-priorities in pre-install phase for
overcloud-base element wich is always used when creating
tripleo images.

Change-Id: I9c9b50d35d411f85a4cbe33ffab4c71d40dfb0f1
Closes-Bug: #1727985

This change checks the return code from ansible-playbook and will send a

commit_message:
Handle ansible-playbook failure for config-download

Previously, the task was only failed if something unexpected happened.
This change checks the return code from ansible-playbook and will send a
failure message out on the zaqar queue for clients to consume.

Change-Id: I12f0b2d4416cf5aa36743326154ccb559a77376b

commit_message:
Add reproduce_command option

Add a new option, reproduce_command to the ansible-playbook action. The
option causes the generated ansible-playbook command to be written out
to the working directory for easy manual reproducing by the user.

The option is True by default.

Change-Id: I54910a18fce132919aa6e3d78d6ec15a62844f47

commit_message:
undercloud_deploy: enable heat-native by default

Requiring heat to be installed on the host OS and simply installing
those deps via RPM package dependencies seems cleaner as it will
allow us to bootstrap docker later at step 1 via puppet created
by the installer itself.

The file in /usr/share is actually called tripleo_kolla_template_overrides.j2. Also, I don't think this is how you wire it in. Typically you'd have a kolla.conf file and in that file you would add a line to set:

template_override=kolla_template_overrides.j2 (NOTE you'd need to use the full path here I think)"}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-09-07 13:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2017-09-08 07:09:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> The file in /usr/share is actually called tripleo_kolla_template_overrides.j2. Also, I don't think this is how you wire it in. Typically you'd have a kolla.conf file and in that file you would add a line to set:
> template_override=kolla_template_overrides.j2 (NOTE you'd need to use the full path here I think)

Thanks Dan for the commands. There are now two different files to be used for kolla build:
(a) tripleo_kolla_template_overrides.j2 - existing, template_override
(b) tripleo_kolla_config_overrides.conf - newly added, all the configs that are overridden by TripleO ([qemu-user])

As I understand, currently the image has been built by providing file (a) via temporary kolla-build.conf file as like provided in sample scripts [1]. This config accepts multiple files to it. 

If we need to add file (a) inside (b) as part of the conf DEFAULT/template_override, I think it should be done on the file [2] in tripleo-common directory. OR add a temporary conf file to include template_override. Let me know if this is the direction we should take. 

This patch only adds the newly added kolla conf [2] file to the default list of kolla-config-file option. I think this should be present irrespective of we include file (a) or not. 



[1] https://github.com/dprince/undercloud_containers/blob/master/build_kolla.sh#L22
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/master/container-images/tripleo_kolla_config_overrides.conf"}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2017-11-16 13:22:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

skramaja: thanks for the explanation. Sorry I missed that new file and held this up.'}, {'account_id': 10034, 'date': '2017-11-20 09:19:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

This patch is required to get the dpdk CI working, please workflow this.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2017-11-21 06:14:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-29 23:51:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Add default kolla conf file for TripleO to build container images

A default kolla conf file is added to the tripleo-common-continers
package, which should be added for building container images by
default.
Closes-Bug: #1712732
Depends-On: I9a2d6b48eb44e294a8501ac0768ea0b97abb4b5c

Change-Id: Id7c665593d8105cadb90bcc7d10b91b17e430922

commit_message:
Add ssl support for manila API access

Currently, Manila does not support secure access the manila
APIs, obviously, this is a defect for manila service. This
change is to add ssl support for manila project.

Closes-bug: #1732844
Closes-bug: #1730529
Change-Id: I2dbc52ce95933e648cc065b2b2112788bf4484d0
(cherry picked from commit fa5b81f903b3ac0028f7e935aea728a443689bfe)

commit_message:
Add group configuration to qemu.conf file

Vhost user sockets are shared between qemu and ovs. Currently,
we are patching ovs service file to make ovs run as qemu user.
In order to avoid it, a new group 'hugetlbfs' has been introduced,
which will be used by ovs and qemu. This patch allows the users
to configure the group setting for qemu.conf file.

Change-Id: I0fa3934b345d51de85fd9d8a5a211b8e1bc50d86

subject: Update oslo.service to 1.27.0
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1955, 'name': 'Alan Pevec', 'email': 'alan.pevec@redhat.com', 'username': 'apevec'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 10384, 'name': 'Hakel Gumar', 'email': 'hguemar@fedoraproject.org', 'username': 'hguemar'}, {'_account_id': 13294, 'name': 'Javier Pea', 'email': 'jpena@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpena'}, {'_account_id': 13404, 'name': 'Alberto Planas', 'email': 'aplanas@gmail.com', 'username': 'aplanas'}, {'_account_id': 19648, 'name': 'SUSE Cloud CI', 'email': 'dmueller+suse-cloud-ci@suse.de', 'username': 'suse-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2017-11-13 15:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2017-11-13 16:36:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2017-11-14 02:01:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2017-11-14 10:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck-rdo'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-11-14 22:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2017-11-15 10:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Builds on SUSE'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-11-16 06:07:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2017-11-16 11:57:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

check-rdo'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-11-20 20:53:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2017-11-23 06:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2017-11-23 08:43:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The RDO CI issue may be related with the version of requests: we have 2.14.2 (the minimum version in global-requirements.txt) vs 2.18.4 in the SUSE CI (the version from upper-constraints.txt).

I'll run some tests locally to confirm this. If so, it can be a bug in oslo.service."}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2017-11-23 11:20:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I've found out that the way python-requests and python-urllib3 are packaged in RDO require pyOpenSSL. Force-uninstalling pyOpenSSL makes the problem go away, so I'm going to run some tests"}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2017-11-23 11:21:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2017-11-23 11:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

PS5 is just a test to confirm if pyOpenSSL + requests break unit tests everywhere.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2017-11-23 13:29:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2017-11-23 13:32:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I have found the issue in the RDO CI. This is a combination of:

- python-pyOpenSSL being installed, which makes urllib3 use a different code path for SSL certificate validation.
- python-cryptography version in RDO is 1.7.2, which is below the current requirement (>=1.9 in global-requirements, with 2.1.3 in upper-constraints).

It looks like python-cryptography cannot extract the SubjectAltName from the SSL certificate used in the tests, which causes them to fail.

While we fix the crypto dependencies, I propose to disable tests when building on RDO. What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 10384, 'date': '2017-11-23 13:42:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

I'll be fixing cryptography in RDO repo => 2.1.3"}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2017-11-23 22:36:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

python-cryptography is now in EL7 base so I wouldn't override it lightly, justification for >=1.9 bump in g-r is unclear if it was really needed.

Let's disable tests as a quickfix and see if unittest can be made to work with both newer and older cryptography."}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2017-11-24 10:26:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2017-11-24 10:39:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Published edit on patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-11-24 10:52:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

Alan, it does require newer pycryptography because of new functionality. I'm certain that you'll not be able to pass tests elsewhere iwth such an old cryptography"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2017-11-24 10:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2017-11-24 10:58:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2017-11-30 18:54:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-13 15:42:54.000000000', 'message': 'Update oslo.service to 1.27.0

commit_message:
Remove some unnecessary excludes from the networking-vsphere spec

Those excludes are for binaries not included in the main package,
but on other subpackages.

Change-Id: I2824e5dafa6ce8b3a4d1d70f59e5c6f2cc761961

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-29 12:32:31.000000000', 'message': 'Remove hard-coded policy choices for creating a server group

The hard-coded choices for the server group policy make it impossible
to create a server group with the soft-affinity or
soft-anti-affinity policy rules which were added in compute API
microversion 2.15. This removes the hard-coded choices so that the
policy is restricted on the server side rather than the client side.

Change-Id: Ib3dc39422ac1015872d56ae2fdeddf0f29613494
Closes-Bug: #1732938
(cherry picked from commit d0917cd14b94ce13fd92237490efb5722761eda4)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove hard-coded policy choices for creating a server group

The hard-coded choices for the server group policy make it impossible
to create a server group with the soft-affinity or
soft-anti-affinity policy rules which were added in compute API
microversion 2.15. This removes the hard-coded choices so that the
policy is restricted on the server side rather than the client side.

Change-Id: Ib3dc39422ac1015872d56ae2fdeddf0f29613494
Closes-Bug: #1732938
(cherry picked from commit d0917cd14b94ce13fd92237490efb5722761eda4)
